title: Will the popularity of baseball influence geopolitical relations between the US and Japan by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there are documented instances where the popularity of baseball has directly influenced geopolitical relations between the United States and Japan. Influences must be significant and could include, but are not limited to:
- Bilateral agreements or treaties where baseball is a central theme or catalyst.
- Joint initiatives or projects between the US and Japan that are inspired by or directly related to baseball.
- Public statements from officials of either country citing baseball as a factor in diplomatic decisions or relations.

Influences must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation from either country. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, NHK World) are sufficient. The influence of baseball on cultural exchanges alone, without clear geopolitical impact, does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Ukraine join NATO before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine becomes a full member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO). Full membership is defined as the completion of all formal accession processes and the official recognition of Ukraine as a NATO member state by the NATO Secretary General or an official NATO communication. The resolution will be based on official announcements from NATO or the Ukrainian government. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. In the event of a partial or observer status, or any other form of affiliation that falls short of full membership, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially announced and scheduled to take place in a country that, at the time of the announcement, is under international sanctions by the United Nations, the European Union, the United States, or any other major international body recognized for imposing sanctions.

For the purpose of this question, "international sanctions" refer to financial, trade, or other sanctions imposed by international bodies or coalitions of countries against a nation for political, economic, or human rights reasons. The sanctions must be widely reported and recognized by reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of a Grand Prix being announced in a country that later has sanctions lifted before the race occurs, the question will still resolve as Yes if the sanctions were in place at the time of the announcement. Temporary or partial lifting of sanctions for the event does not affect the resolution.

This question does not consider unofficial or speculative announcements. Confirmation must come from the Formula 1 organization or the sanctioned country's government.

title: Will a new infectious disease prompt the development of nuclear biocontainment technologies before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the development of nuclear biocontainment technologies is initiated in response to a new infectious disease. Nuclear biocontainment technologies refer to the use of nuclear energy or radiation to contain, eliminate, or manage infectious agents in a way that prevents their spread or treats infected individuals. The development must be confirmed by an official announcement from a recognized government body, research institution, or corporation involved in nuclear technology or biocontainment. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The technology must be beyond the conceptual phase, with evidence of physical prototypes or active development projects. In the event of multiple developments, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed initiative. Temporary or experimental applications not intended for widespread use do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the US Senate pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US Senate has passed legislation that significantly amends or introduces new nuclear safety standards. Significant legislation is defined as a bill that introduces new regulations, enhances existing safety protocols, or provides substantial funding towards nuclear safety improvements. The legislation must be passed by the US Senate and must not solely be a resolution or declaration without actionable items. Confirmation of the passage of such legislation must come from official government sources or be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event of a government shutdown or other extraordinary circumstances that prevent the Senate from convening, the resolution date will be extended to accommodate the duration of such events.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified nuclear waste management policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the European Union has officially implemented a unified policy for the management of nuclear waste across all member states. The policy must cover the entire lifecycle of nuclear waste, from production to disposal, and must be applicable in all EU member states without exception. Implementation is defined as the policy being legally binding and in effect, with evidence of enforcement mechanisms or guidelines being actively applied in multiple member states. The confirmation of such a policy must come from an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., applicable only to certain types of nuclear waste or in a limited number of member states), the question will resolve as No unless the policy is explicitly intended for and on a clear path towards full EU-wide application.

title: Will the integration of information technology in education significantly reduce the global digital divide by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant reduction in the global digital divide as a result of the integration of information technology in education. A significant reduction is defined as:
- At least a 50% decrease in the number of individuals worldwide without access to digital devices and the internet.
- A measurable improvement in digital literacy rates across all age groups, particularly in underdeveloped and developing countries.

The assessment of the global digital divide will be based on reports and data from authoritative sources such as the United Nations, World Bank, International Telecommunication Union (ITU), and UNESCO. The integration of information technology in education includes, but is not limited to, the provision of digital devices, internet access, digital literacy programs, and online learning platforms.

In the absence of clear data, a consensus among at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or a publication in a peer-reviewed journal will be sufficient for resolution. The question will resolve as No if these criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams lead to a significant increase in global soccer viewership by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant increase in global soccer viewership attributed to the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams. A "significant increase" is defined as a 20% rise in average global viewership numbers for FIFA World Cup events, compared to the average viewership of the three World Cups held prior to the expansion. The assessment of viewership numbers will be based on official FIFA reports or, in their absence, credible data from major sports analytics firms. In the event that FIFA changes the format again before 2030, or if the expansion does not occur, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "global soccer viewership" includes both live attendance and television/internet broadcast audiences worldwide.

title: Will South Korea become the leader in global digital governance by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea is recognized as the global leader in digital governance. Recognition must come from at least two of the following authoritative sources: the United Nations, the World Bank, the Digital Nations (formerly known as the D5), or a consensus among at least three major technology-focused publications (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, The Verge). Criteria for leadership in digital governance include but are not limited to: - Implementation of advanced digital services across government sectors. - Adoption of cutting-edge technologies in public administration. - Demonstrable impact of digital governance on improving public services and citizen engagement. - Leadership in international digital policy discussions and agreements. In the event of a tie or close competition with another nation, the question will resolve as Yes only if South Korea is clearly distinguished as the leader by the majority of the aforementioned sources. Edge cases, such as temporary leadership positions or recognition in a single aspect of digital governance, do not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will Microsoft's carbon negative pledge significantly impact global CO2 levels by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Microsoft's carbon negative pledge has resulted in a measurable and significant reduction in global CO2 levels. A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease in global CO2 levels by at least 0.1% from 2020 levels, attributable directly to Microsoft's initiatives. This includes, but is not limited to, direct carbon capture and storage efforts, renewable energy investments, and ecosystem restoration projects. The assessment must be confirmed by data from authoritative sources such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the International Energy Agency (IEA). In the absence of direct attribution to Microsoft's efforts, a consensus among at least three reputable scientific publications or environmental organizations is required. The resolution will consider only actions taken by Microsoft up to December 31, 2030, and their impact on CO2 levels by that date. Temporary or reversible actions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a breakthrough in physics lead to a new form of clean energy by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a breakthrough in physics results in the development of a new form of clean energy that meets the following criteria:

- The energy source must be widely recognized as "clean," meaning it has minimal negative impact on the environment and emits low to no greenhouse gases during production or use.
- The breakthrough must be documented in at least one peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by a reputable scientific organization or consensus within the scientific community.
- The new energy source must be proven to be scalable for widespread use and demonstrate a significant advantage over existing clean energy sources in terms of efficiency, cost, or environmental impact.
- The development of the new energy source must be confirmed by an official announcement from a leading research institution or a major energy company.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The energy source must be operational, not merely theoretical or in a prototype phase, by the resolution date.

title: Will the World Health Organization declare a global health emergency due to climate-related diseases by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the World Health Organization (WHO) has officially declared a global health emergency specifically due to the rise in diseases directly attributed to climate change. Such diseases may include, but are not limited to, vector-borne diseases, water-borne diseases, food safety and nutrition-related conditions, and respiratory and cardiovascular diseases linked to air pollution. The declaration must be made explicitly in relation to climate change impacts on health, and must be documented through official WHO announcements or press releases. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the declaration will be sufficient for resolution. Temporary alerts or warnings specific to individual diseases or regions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will India become a global leader in quantum computing by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, India is recognized as a global leader in the field of quantum computing. Recognition as a global leader requires:
- India hosting at least one quantum computer that ranks among the top 5 in the world for computational power, as reported by a reputable global technology or scientific organization.
- Indian-based researchers or institutions publishing at least 20 significant, peer-reviewed research papers on quantum computing in top-tier scientific journals.
- India successfully commercializing quantum computing technologies, with at least one Indian company being among the top 5 globally in terms of market share or technological innovation in quantum computing.

Recognition must come from authoritative sources in the field of quantum computing, such as the IEEE, the International Quantum Computing Institute, or similar. Reports from major global technology news outlets (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, Bloomberg Technology) can also contribute to this recognition. In the absence of clear global leadership, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major breakthrough in COVID-19 vaccine development be achieved through the use of artificial intelligence by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in COVID-19 vaccine development is achieved with significant contribution from artificial intelligence (AI). A "major breakthrough" is defined as the development of a vaccine that demonstrates at least a 90% efficacy rate in preventing COVID-19 in Phase 3 clinical trials, as reported by a regulatory body such as the FDA, EMA, or WHO. The contribution of AI must be clearly documented and recognized in the research findings or publication, indicating that AI played a crucial role in the vaccine's development, such as through the identification of novel vaccine targets, acceleration of vaccine design, or optimization of vaccine formulations. The breakthrough must be confirmed by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement from a leading health organization. In the absence of direct publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The vaccine must be approved for public use by the specified resolution date.

title: Will Australia launch its own sovereign satellite navigation system by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Australia has officially launched its own sovereign satellite navigation system. The system must be fully operational and capable of providing satellite navigation services independently of other global navigation satellite systems (GNSS), such as GPS (United States), GLONASS (Russia), Galileo (European Union), or BeiDou (China). The launch of the system must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Australian government or a recognized space agency within Australia. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must provide coverage and services specifically designed for Australian territory and its maritime regions. In the event of a collaborative project with other countries or entities, the question will resolve as Yes only if Australia retains primary control and operation of the system. Temporary or trial services do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the integration of cricket analytics technology significantly influence team strategies in major leagues by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is significant evidence that cricket analytics technology has been integrated into the team strategies of major cricket leagues (e.g., Indian Premier League, Big Bash League, Caribbean Premier League) and has influenced decision-making processes in areas such as player selection, in-game tactics, and training methodologies. Significant influence is defined as changes in team strategies or decision-making processes that are directly attributed to the use of cricket analytics technology, as reported by at least three reputable sources (e.g., ESPNcricinfo, The Guardian, BBC Sport). The technology must be used in a way that is integral to team operations, not merely for isolated instances or experimental purposes. In the event of ambiguous cases, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert opinion within the cricketing community. The question will resolve as No if such evidence is not found by the specified date.

title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, machine learning algorithms have been demonstrated to surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior in at least one major industry (e.g., retail, finance, entertainment). The surpassing of human accuracy must be evidenced by a peer-reviewed study or a comprehensive report from a reputable analytics or research firm. The study or report must compare the predictive accuracy of machine learning algorithms against that of experienced human professionals in the same field, using standardized metrics for accuracy. The findings must be recognized and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or industry-specific publications. In the event of conflicting reports or studies, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the most reputable sources. Machine learning algorithms are defined as systems that use statistical techniques to learn from data and make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed for the task.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) implement a policy to significantly boost technology startups by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Democratic Party in the United States has implemented a policy or a set of policies aimed at significantly boosting technology startups. Significant boost refers to policies that directly result in increased funding, tax incentives, regulatory changes, or other support mechanisms that demonstrably aid the growth and establishment of technology startups. The policy must be enacted into law or officially adopted by a relevant governmental body. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. Temporary measures or proposals not enacted into law do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will North Korea undergo a major legal reform by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, North Korea has officially announced and implemented a major legal reform. A "major legal reform" is defined as a significant change in the legal system or constitution that affects the governance structure, human rights, or the legal process in a way that is recognized by the international community. The reform must be documented by official North Korean government sources or confirmed by at least three reputable international news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters). In the absence of direct government announcement, credible reports from human rights organizations such as Amnesty International or Human Rights Watch, corroborated by independent international legal experts, will also be considered. The question will resolve as No if such reforms are announced but not implemented by the deadline.

title: Will a landmark legal case involving quantum mechanics principles emerge before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a legal case is recognized as a landmark case involving the principles of quantum mechanics. A "landmark case" is defined as a case that sets a precedent, significantly influences the law, legal processes, or government policy, and is widely recognized within the legal community and by reputable news sources. The case must explicitly involve the principles of quantum mechanics as a central issue. Recognition must come from official legal documentation or announcements, or in the absence of such, by coverage in at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event of multiple qualifying cases, the first to be officially recognized as meeting these criteria will determine the resolution. This question resolves as YES upon such recognition, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

title: Will a significant international climate change treaty be ratified by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant international climate change treaty is ratified. A "significant" treaty is defined as one that includes commitments from at least 75% of the world's nations and aims to reduce global greenhouse gas emissions by at least 40% from 1990 levels by 2050. The treaty must be ratified by the participating countries' governments or relevant governing bodies. Ratification is confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The treaty must be new, not an amendment or extension of an existing treaty. In the event of multiple treaties, the question resolves as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will Amazon's market share in the global e-commerce sector exceed 50% by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon's market share in the global e-commerce sector exceeds 50%. Market share will be determined based on the total retail value of goods sold through Amazon's e-commerce platforms, including its main website and any subsidiaries, as a percentage of the total global e-commerce retail value. The assessment will rely on data published by reputable market research firms such as Statista, eMarketer, or similar. In the absence of a single authoritative source, a consensus from at least three reputable market research reports will be used to determine the outcome. The calculation of market share will exclude services not directly related to e-commerce, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Amazon Prime subscriptions, and digital streaming services. In the event of significant discrepancies between sources, the resolution will default to the median value reported by the sources considered.

title: Will a major technology company face a landmark ethics investigation by the United States government before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major technology company (defined as a company with a market capitalization exceeding $100 billion USD at the time of the investigation's announcement) faces a landmark ethics investigation by the United States government. A "landmark ethics investigation" is defined as an investigation that is publicly announced by a U.S. federal government agency, such as the Federal Trade Commission (FTC), the Department of Justice (DOJ), or the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), and involves allegations of significant ethical breaches that could potentially lead to regulatory changes, substantial fines, or major shifts in company policy. The investigation must be new and not a continuation or expansion of previously known issues. Confirmation of such an investigation must come from official government releases or credible news reports from reputable sources such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Bloomberg. In the event of ambiguous situations, the resolution will default to a No unless clear evidence is presented.

title: Will the United States lead the world in quantum computing technology development by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is recognized as the global leader in the development of quantum computing technology. Leadership will be determined based on the following criteria:

- Number of quantum computers developed that surpass the capabilities of existing classical computers in significant computational tasks (quantum supremacy).
- Volume and impact of peer-reviewed scientific publications originating from the United States that contribute to quantum computing technology.
- Investment in quantum computing research and development by both the public and private sectors in the United States, compared to other countries.

Global leadership must be recognized by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the International Quantum Computing Association, the IEEE Quantum Computing Task Force, or significant coverage in at least three major technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, MIT Technology Review, Nature).

In the event of a dispute over leadership, the consensus among these sources will be considered definitive.

title: Will a major breakthrough in biology lead to a significant shift in social sciences research methodologies by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in biology leads to a significant shift in social sciences research methodologies. A "major breakthrough in biology" refers to a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of biological concepts in a way that is widely recognized by the scientific community. A "significant shift in social sciences research methodologies" refers to the adoption of new or substantially modified research methods, theories, or practices in the social sciences, as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals, changes in university curricula, or widespread adoption by the research community. The breakthrough and its impact on social sciences must be documented and recognized by authoritative sources in both fields, such as leading scientific journals (e.g., Nature, Science), major academic institutions, or professional societies. In the event of ambiguity, the consensus of experts in both biology and social sciences will be considered.

title: Will advancements in microbiology influence global health policies more than technology by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, advancements in microbiology have had a more significant influence on global health policies than technological advancements. Influence on global health policies is defined as the adoption of new or revised policies, guidelines, or recommendations by at least three of the following organizations: World Health Organization (WHO), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), or similar national or international health bodies. The influence of microbiology advancements is measured by the direct citation of microbiological research or data in the formulation of these policies. Technological advancements include, but are not limited to, developments in medical devices, health information technologies, and biotechnology. The comparison between the influences of microbiology and technology will be assessed based on the number of policies influenced, the scope of the impact, and the depth of the changes implemented. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the widespread adoption of COVID-19 vaccines lead to a permanent change in workplace dynamics by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant and permanent change in workplace dynamics directly attributable to the widespread adoption of COVID-19 vaccines. Significant change is defined as:
- A permanent increase of at least 20% in the number of employees working remotely or in hybrid models compared to pre-pandemic levels (2019).
- The implementation of permanent flexible working hours by at least 50% of Fortune 500 companies.
- The establishment of permanent health and safety protocols in the workplace, including but not limited to vaccination requirements, that were not standard prior to the pandemic.

Changes must be documented by credible sources, including but not limited to surveys by major human resources consultancies (e.g., Deloitte, PwC), reports from reputable news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian), or official statements from companies. Temporary measures or changes solely due to government mandates that are lifted do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the discovery of dark matter lead to new economic industries by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has led to the establishment of new economic industries. These industries must be directly related to the utilization, research, or technology development of dark matter and must represent a new sector of the economy not previously existing. The establishment of such industries must be confirmed by at least one of the following: 
- Official announcement from a major economic or scientific institution. 
- Coverage in at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 
- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific or economic journal. 
For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the hypothetical form of matter thought to account for approximately 85% of the matter in the universe and about a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic industries" refers to sectors or fields of economic activity that are newly created and have not been previously classified as part of the existing economic landscape.

title: Will a major breakthrough in pharmacology create a billion-dollar industry by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in pharmacology leads to the creation of a new industry or significantly transforms an existing one, resulting in a market valuation of at least one billion US dollars. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community and have a clear, direct impact on the market. The valuation must be confirmed by credible financial reports or analyses from reputable sources such as Forbes, Bloomberg, or the Financial Times. In the event of multiple qualifying breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. The breakthrough must be publicly documented and recognized within the pharmacological or financial communities by the specified date.

title: Will SpaceX's Starship enable the commercialization of space travel by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX has officially begun commercial operations of its Starship spacecraft for the purpose of space travel accessible to non-governmental, paying customers. Commercialization is defined as offering and conducting paid space travel services to individuals or private entities beyond governmental or scientific missions. The service must be operational, with at least one commercial flight completed. Confirmation must come from an official SpaceX announcement or credible media reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of a partial service offering (e.g., limited to specific routes or types of customers), the question will resolve as Yes if the service is intended for broader public availability. Temporary or promotional one-off flights do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Japan implement a nationwide carbon neutrality policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Japan has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at achieving carbon neutrality. The policy must encompass significant measures across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, and industry, with the goal of reducing net carbon emissions to zero. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be in active enforcement, not merely proposed or in planning stages. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes if there is a clear, government-stated timeline and commitment for nationwide application. Temporary measures or policies with a focus solely on carbon offsetting without direct emission reductions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the global average temperature rise by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global average temperature has risen by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels (defined as the average global temperature from 1850-1900). The assessment must be based on the annual average global surface temperature data as reported by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or another authoritative scientific body that provides a comprehensive analysis of global temperatures. In the event that the IPCC or equivalent body does not provide a clear statement or report by the resolution date, this question will resolve based on the consensus of reports from at least three major scientific organizations dedicated to climate science. Edge cases, such as significant revisions to historical temperature data or changes in the methodology for calculating global average temperatures, will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for the most widely accepted scientific standards at the time of resolution.

title: Will a major breakthrough in genetics lead to a significant increase in crop resilience to climate change by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in genetics leads to a significant increase in crop resilience to climate change. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that results in a measurable and significant improvement in crop resilience against factors such as drought, temperature extremes, salinity, and pests, compared to the state of the art as of 2023.

The increase in resilience must be demonstrated through peer-reviewed scientific research, recognized by the global scientific community, and must show practical application in at least three different major crops (e.g., rice, wheat, maize).

The breakthrough must be widely recognized by authoritative bodies in the field of agricultural science or genetics, such as the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) or the International Society for Plant Pathology. In the absence of direct recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if any one discovery meets the above criteria.

title: Will Microsoft engage in a significant geopolitical initiative by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Microsoft has officially announced or is actively participating in a significant geopolitical initiative. A "significant geopolitical initiative" is defined as an effort or project that has a substantial impact on international relations, global policies, or geopolitical landscapes, and involves collaboration or engagement with one or more national governments, international organizations, or significant non-state actors. The initiative must be aimed at addressing major global challenges such as climate change, cybersecurity, digital privacy, international trade, or global health crises. Confirmation must come from official Microsoft announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of ambiguity or disputed claims, the resolution will defer to the consensus of reputable news sources.

title: Will the MLB's international expansion efforts significantly influence geopolitical relations by 2030?
Will a major golf tournament be used as a diplomatic tool in international relations by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major golf tournament (defined as one of the four major championships: The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or the PGA Championship) is officially used as a platform for diplomatic engagement or to facilitate international relations. This includes, but is not limited to, hosting diplomatic talks, signing treaties, or public announcements of international agreements during the event or as a direct result of meetings held at the event. The use of the tournament for diplomatic purposes must be confirmed by official government statements from at least one of the countries involved or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event of a dispute over the interpretation of 'used as a diplomatic tool,' the consensus among these reported sources will be considered authoritative. Temporary or symbolic gestures without substantive diplomatic outcomes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Russo-Ukrainian War has directly led to significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies. Significant advancements are defined as:
- The development and deployment of new cybersecurity technologies or methodologies that represent a substantial improvement over existing capabilities.
- The adoption of these technologies or methodologies by major governments, corporations, or cybersecurity organizations.

Advancements must be directly attributable to the challenges or experiences derived from the Russo-Ukrainian War. This can include, but is not limited to, enhanced intrusion detection systems, improved encryption methods, or novel approaches to cybersecurity education and training.

Confirmation of such advancements must come from credible sources, including official government statements, reports from reputable cybersecurity firms, or coverage in major technology or news publications (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, BBC, The New York Times). In the absence of direct statements, consensus among cybersecurity experts, as reported in multiple reputable sources, will be sufficient.

In the event of ambiguous advancements, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear consensus among experts that the advancements are both significant and directly attributable to the war.

title: Will a major technological breakthrough in artificial intelligence be influenced by philosophical theories by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major technological breakthrough in artificial intelligence (AI) is officially recognized and can be directly attributed to the influence of philosophical theories. A "major technological breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly advances the field of AI in terms of capabilities, efficiency, or understanding, and is recognized as such by a consensus of experts in the field or a leading AI research institution. The influence of philosophical theories must be explicitly acknowledged in the official announcement of the breakthrough, or in the primary scientific literature describing the breakthrough (e.g., peer-reviewed journal articles, conference papers). The acknowledgment must specify how philosophical theories influenced the breakthrough, whether in the design, conceptual framework, or implementation of the AI technology. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the breakthrough and its philosophical influence. If multiple breakthroughs meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such confirmation.

title: Will California introduce groundbreaking legislation on digital privacy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, California has officially introduced legislation that is recognized as groundbreaking in the field of digital privacy. Groundbreaking legislation is defined as laws that significantly enhance the protection of digital privacy rights beyond the current standards as of 2023, or introduce new rights or mechanisms for the protection of digital data that are not present in existing California law or federal law. The legislation must be passed by the California State Legislature and signed into law by the Governor. Confirmation of such legislation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. Proposed but not enacted legislation, or minor amendments to existing laws, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) secure a majority in both the House of Representatives and the Senate in the 2024 elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2025, the Democratic Party has secured a majority of seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate following the 2024 United States general elections. A majority in the House of Representatives is defined as holding more than half of the total seats, which currently stands at 218 out of 435. A majority in the Senate is defined as holding more than half of the total seats, which currently stands at 51 out of 100, or 50 seats plus the Vice President's tie-breaking vote if the Vice President is a Democrat. The resolution will be based on the official election results as certified by the respective state authorities and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, CNN). In the event of a dispute or recount that delays the certification of election results, the resolution date may be extended to accommodate the final certification.

title: Will a political figure announce a formal initiative to integrate Formula 1 racing into national economic development plans by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a current political figure has formally announced an initiative to integrate Formula 1 racing into their country's national economic development plans. The announcement must be made through official government channels, such as a press release, government website, or an official speech. The initiative must aim at leveraging Formula 1 racing for economic benefits, including but not limited to tourism enhancement, infrastructure development, or technological innovation. Confirmation from at least two reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) is required in the absence of a direct government announcement. The political figure must hold a national office (e.g., President, Prime Minister, Cabinet Member) at the time of the announcement. Initiatives focused solely on local or regional development, or statements lacking formal government backing, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new global pandemic treaty be established by the WHO with unanimous support from all member countries by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the World Health Organization (WHO) has established a new global pandemic treaty that has received unanimous support from all member countries. 

For the purposes of this question, a "global pandemic treaty" refers to a formal, legally binding agreement between WHO member countries aimed at preventing, preparing for, and responding to future pandemics. Unanimous support means that all member countries of the WHO at the time of the treaty's establishment have formally agreed to the treaty's terms without exception. 

Confirmation must come from an official WHO announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. 

In the event that the WHO gains new members after the establishment of the treaty but before the resolution date, the treaty must have been agreed upon by all members present at the time of establishment for this question to resolve as Yes.

title: Will a machine learning model surpass human accuracy in diagnosing diseases by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a machine learning model is officially recognized to surpass human accuracy in diagnosing diseases. The model must demonstrate superior accuracy across multiple diseases in a peer-reviewed study or studies, compared to the consensus accuracy rates of medical professionals in those domains. The study or studies must be published in a reputable medical journal and the findings must be validated by at least one independent research institution or a recognized medical authority. The model's performance must be evaluated in real-world conditions, not solely in controlled or laboratory settings. In the event of multiple models achieving this milestone, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such recognition. The resolution will rely on reports from authoritative sources in the medical and scientific community, including but not limited to the World Health Organization, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and major medical journals.

title: Will Amazon deploy an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially deployed an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management across any of its operational warehouses. A "fully autonomous warehouse management" system is defined as a system that can independently handle all aspects of warehouse operations, including but not limited to inventory management, order processing, packaging, and shipping, without human intervention. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific warehouses or areas), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide or global expansion. Temporary deployments for specific events or the use of similar technology in private spaces do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US rule on a case involving AI-generated content's copyright by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States has issued a ruling on a case that directly involves the copyright of AI-generated content. The case must specifically address the legal status of content created by artificial intelligence, without human authorship, in the context of copyright law. The ruling must clarify whether AI-generated content is eligible for copyright protection under U.S. law. For the question to resolve as Yes, the ruling must be publicly available and verifiable through official court documents or announcements. In the absence of a direct ruling, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the Supreme Court's decision will be considered sufficient. This question does not consider lower court rulings or legislative changes unless they are explicitly endorsed or referenced by the Supreme Court in its ruling.

title: Will Sweden introduce a universal basic income policy before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Sweden officially introduces a universal basic income (UBI) policy that provides regular, unconditional payments to all its citizens or residents, regardless of employment status. The policy must be enacted by the Swedish government and cover the entire population of Sweden, not limited to specific groups or regions. The introduction of UBI must be confirmed through official government announcements or legislation. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Pilot programs, trials, or proposals do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will France implement a nationwide carbon-neutral initiative by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide initiative that is recognized as carbon-neutral. The initiative must encompass actions across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, industry, and agriculture, aimed at achieving a net-zero carbon footprint for the country.

The initiative must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

For the purpose of this question, "carbon-neutral" means that any carbon emissions produced by France are balanced by an equivalent amount of carbon sequestration or offsetting measures, within the same calendar year. The verification of carbon neutrality must be conducted by an independent, internationally recognized environmental organization.

In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide coverage by the end of 2030.

title: Will Ukraine's GDP per capita surpass that of Poland before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine's GDP per capita, as reported by the World Bank or another internationally recognized economic organization, surpasses that of Poland for any fiscal year. The GDP per capita should be calculated based on current US dollars for consistency. In the event that the World Bank or the designated authoritative source discontinues its reporting or significantly changes its methodology, an alternative reputable source will be used, following the same criteria for GDP per capita calculation. This question does not consider temporary fluctuations; the GDP per capita must be higher in one fiscal year compared to the previous year's report for Poland.

title: Will a new infectious disease be identified that significantly impacts global health by 2025?
Will there be a significant discovery in robotics that contributes to the advancement of natural sciences by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in robotics has been made that contributes to the advancement of the natural sciences. A "significant discovery" is defined as a development in robotics technology or application that leads to a breakthrough in understanding, methodology, or application in any field of the natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics, earth science). The discovery must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, citation in multiple subsequent research works, or acknowledgment by a reputable scientific organization. The advancement must be directly attributable to the robotics discovery and represent a clear departure from existing capabilities or knowledge. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Discoveries that are primarily advancements in computer science or engineering without direct application to the natural sciences do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a groundbreaking discovery in natural sciences that influences the development of sports technologies by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a groundbreaking discovery in the natural sciences is announced that significantly influences the development of sports technologies. A "groundbreaking discovery" is defined as a scientific finding or innovation that represents a significant advancement in understanding or application within the fields of physics, chemistry, biology, or earth sciences, and has a direct and substantial impact on the design, performance, safety, or functionality of sports equipment, wearables, training methodologies, or performance analysis systems. The influence on sports technologies must be evidenced by the adoption of the discovery in commercially available products, professional sports team practices, or widely recognized sports performance research. The discovery must be recognized by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, and the impact on sports technologies must be documented by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or industry publications. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will a new chemical element related to nuclear technology be discovered by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new chemical element that has applications in nuclear technology is officially discovered and recognized by the scientific community. The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal and acknowledged by a leading authority in the field, such as the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) or the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The element must be identified as having potential or actual applications in nuclear technology, including but not limited to, energy production, radiation shielding, or nuclear medicine. In the event of multiple claims of discovery, the question will resolve as Yes based on the first discovery that meets these criteria and is officially recognized. Discoveries that are later disproven or retracted will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Italy phase out all nuclear power plants by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Italy has officially phased out all operational nuclear power plants within its territory. Phasing out is defined as the cessation of electricity production by nuclear fission in all facilities that were operational or under construction as of the date of this question. The closure of each facility must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event that new nuclear power plants are announced or constructed after the date of this question, they must also be closed by the resolution date for this question to resolve as Yes. Temporary shutdowns for maintenance or safety checks do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology be achieved by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology is achieved and publicly announced. A "breakthrough" is defined as achieving a net energy gain from a nuclear fusion reaction that is sustainable and reproducible in a controlled environment. The breakthrough must be recognized and confirmed by at least one of the following: the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the Department of Energy (DOE) of the United States, or a similar authoritative body in the field of nuclear energy. Additionally, the achievement must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The question will resolve as No if these conditions are not met by the specified date.

title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in image recognition by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, machine learning algorithms have surpassed human accuracy in image recognition tasks. 

"Human accuracy" refers to the average accuracy rate of a group of humans (at least 100 individuals) performing the same image recognition tasks under controlled conditions. 

"Surpass" is defined as achieving a higher accuracy rate, confirmed by at least two independent studies published in peer-reviewed scientific journals or presented at major AI or computer science conferences. 

The studies must compare the performance of machine learning algorithms directly against human performance on identical tasks. The resolution will be based on the consensus of the scientific community or authoritative sources in the field of artificial intelligence and computer science.

title: Will the development of technology significantly influence the outcome of the 2024 US presidential election?
Will the NFL adopt AI-driven strategies for game planning and player training by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) has officially adopted artificial intelligence-driven strategies for game planning and/or player training across any of its teams. Adoption must be confirmed through official NFL announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic, NFL.com) are sufficient. AI-driven strategies refer to the use of artificial intelligence systems to analyze player performance, strategize game plays, or enhance player training and rehabilitation. The technology must be in active use, not in a trial phase. If only specific teams have adopted such strategies, the question will resolve as Yes if there is an intention or confirmed plan for league-wide adoption. Temporary or experimental use for specific games or seasons does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will North Korea announce a formal initiative to address climate change by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, North Korea has officially announced a formal initiative to address climate change. The initiative must be aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, promoting renewable energy, or other significant environmental protection measures. The announcement must come from an official government source or be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the absence of a direct announcement, credible evidence of the initiative's implementation (e.g., legislative action, funding allocation) reported by these sources will also result in a Yes resolution. Initiatives that are purely rhetorical without concrete actions or plans will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Germany achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Germany has officially achieved a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels. The assessment must be based on the official data released by the German Federal Environment Agency (Umweltbundesamt) or an equivalent authoritative body. The emissions data must include all sectors of the economy, including energy, industrial processes, agriculture, waste management, and land use, land-use change, and forestry (LULUCF). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the achievement are sufficient. Interim targets or projections do not count towards this question's resolution. The question will resolve as No if the required reduction is not met or officially confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will the Amazon rainforest's rate of deforestation decrease by 30% by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the rate of deforestation in the Amazon rainforest has decreased by at least 30% compared to the rate recorded in the year 2020.
The assessment of the deforestation rate will be based on data provided by the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) of Brazil, or any other authoritative source recognized by the international scientific community.
In the event that INPE or equivalent authoritative data is not available for 2025, this question will resolve using the most recent data available from these sources prior to 2025.
For the purpose of this question, "deforestation" refers to the permanent removal of primary forest cover in the Amazon basin. Temporary changes in forest cover due to natural events (e.g., fires, floods) that are expected to recover naturally do not count towards the deforestation rate.

title: Will North Korea hold a free and fair presidential election before 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, North Korea holds a presidential election that is widely recognized as free and fair by a majority of the following international observers: the United Nations, the European Union, and the Carter Center. A 'free and fair' election is defined as one where there is universal suffrage for all citizens aged 18 and over, no significant reports of voter intimidation or fraud, and where multiple political parties have the freedom to run. The election must be confirmed by official North Korean government announcements and verified by reports from at least three reputable international news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian). In the absence of such an election, or if the criteria are not met, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major election in a democratic country be significantly influenced by a sudden atmospheric event before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major election in a democratic country is significantly influenced by a sudden atmospheric event. A "major election" is defined as a presidential, parliamentary, or general election in a country recognized as a democracy by the Economist Intelligence Unit's Democracy Index. A "sudden atmospheric event" includes but is not limited to hurricanes, tornadoes, blizzards, heatwaves, and significant air pollution events. The influence on the election must be substantial, leading to a significant change in the election date, voting process, or outcome. The event and its impact on the election must be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple atmospheric events influencing elections in different countries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed instance. Edge cases will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a focus on the intent of the question and the significance of the atmospheric event's impact on the election process or outcome.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark ruling that significantly affects the outcome of a presidential election before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that directly influences the outcome of a presidential election. A ruling is considered to have a significant effect if it alters the result of an election or has a decisive impact on the electoral process in a manner that could change the outcome. This includes, but is not limited to, decisions on electoral disputes, voting rights, candidate eligibility, or election procedures. The ruling must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Guardian). In the event of multiple rulings, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first ruling that meets these criteria. In cases where the impact of a ruling is disputed, this question will resolve based on the consensus of legal analysts in major legal publications or news outlets.

title: Will a new element be discovered by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new chemical element is officially recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC). The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research and meet the IUPAC criteria for the recognition of new elements, including but not limited to the observation of the element in a laboratory setting and the verification of its atomic number. The element must be added to the periodic table and assigned an official name and symbol by the IUPAC. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one new element meets these criteria. Discoveries announced but not confirmed by the IUPAC by the resolution date will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant scientific discovery that influences US environmental policy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant scientific discovery is made that directly influences United States environmental policy. A "significant scientific discovery" is defined as a discovery that leads to the enactment of new legislation, significant amendment of existing legislation, or a major shift in policy direction at the federal level. The discovery must be related to environmental science and must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, as evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or endorsement by a major scientific organization. The influence on policy must be clearly attributable to the discovery, as confirmed by official government documentation or statements from relevant policymakers. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of the discovery's impact on policy. Temporary measures or executive orders that do not lead to lasting policy change do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technologies emerge from Iran by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technologies is announced to have emerged from Iran. A "major scientific breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that significantly advances the field of renewable energy, such as a new method of energy generation, storage, or efficiency improvement that surpasses current leading technologies by at least 20% in efficiency or cost-effectiveness. The breakthrough must be recognized by the international scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact or a major international scientific award. Reports from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the breakthrough and its significance are also required. The breakthrough must be attributed to research conducted primarily in Iran, regardless of the nationality of the researchers.

title: Will the NBA invest in space-related technologies or sponsor a space mission by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the National Basketball Association (NBA) has officially invested in space-related technologies or sponsored a space mission. An investment or sponsorship is considered official if it is announced by the NBA through an official press release, documented in official NBA financial statements, or confirmed through credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, The New York Times, The Guardian, BBC). The investment or sponsorship must be directly related to space technologies, exploration, or missions and must be intended to support or advance space exploration or technology development. Temporary marketing promotions or partnerships that do not involve financial investment or sponsorship of space technology development or missions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant discovery in space lead to a new economic model or job sector as predicted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in space leads to the creation of a new economic model or job sector, as predicted or recognized by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). A "significant discovery in space" refers to any discovery beyond Earth's atmosphere that has a direct and substantial impact on economic models, job creation, or the restructuring of existing job sectors. The new economic model or job sector must be officially acknowledged by the BLS in their publications or on their official website. In the absence of direct acknowledgment from the BLS, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the economic impact of the discovery will suffice. The discovery must lead to the creation of jobs that did not exist prior to the discovery, and these jobs must be recognized as part of a new sector or economic model. Temporary or speculative job creation does not meet this criterion. The question resolves as Yes only if the new economic model or job sector is operational and recognized by the end of 2030.

title: Will the value of investments in space exploration exceed the market capitalization of the US dollar by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the total value of investments in space exploration exceeds the market capitalization of the US dollar. The value of investments in space exploration includes all public and private funding, grants, and investments directed towards space exploration projects, including but not limited to satellite launches, manned missions, space station construction, and deep space probes. The market capitalization of the US dollar will be calculated based on the total amount of USD in circulation, including physical currency and digital forms, as reported by the United States Federal Reserve. Resolution will be based on data and reports from authoritative financial and space exploration entities, such as the United States Federal Reserve, NASA, ESA, SpaceX, and other recognized organizations in the field. In the event of conflicting reports, a consensus from at least three reputable financial or space exploration news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, Space News) will be required for resolution.

title: Will a machine learning model be used to predict significant natural disasters with over 90% accuracy by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a machine learning model is used to predict significant natural disasters (including but not limited to earthquakes, hurricanes, tsunamis, and volcanic eruptions) with over 90% accuracy. 

Significant natural disasters are defined as events causing substantial damage, significant economic loss, or loss of life. The model must predict the location, time frame (within a 48-hour window), and magnitude of the event with over 90% accuracy, verified by subsequent events. 

The prediction model must be recognized and validated by a reputable scientific or governmental organization involved in disaster management or research. 

In the absence of official validation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the use and accuracy of the model are sufficient. 

The model must be operational and used in a real-world scenario, not solely within a research or trial setting.

title: Will a significant discovery in the field of natural sciences be named after a concept or phenomenon related to tennis by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in the field of natural sciences (including but not limited to physics, chemistry, biology, and earth sciences) is officially named after a concept or phenomenon directly related to the sport of tennis. The discovery must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, and the name must be clearly inspired by tennis terminology (e.g., a physical phenomenon named "Serve Effect," a chemical compound called "Deuce Molecule," or a biological species named after a famous tennis player). The naming must be confirmed through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement by a leading scientific organization. In the event of ambiguity in the tennis-related naming, a consensus among experts in the relevant field of science, as reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), will be required for resolution. This question resolves as YES upon such confirmation.

title: Will a new species of plant or animal be discovered in Virginia that significantly impacts the field of natural sciences by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new species of plant or animal is discovered in Virginia and is recognized by the scientific community as having a significant impact on the field of natural sciences. The discovery must be documented and described in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The impact is considered significant if it leads to new insights or theories in biology, ecology, conservation, or a related field, and is acknowledged as such by a reputable scientific organization or a consensus of experts in the relevant field. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one discovery meets these criteria. Discoveries made but not recognized within the timeframe do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major golf tournament significantly impact local economies in a measurable way by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is measurable and significant economic impact attributed to a major golf tournament in any locality where such an event is held. Significant economic impact is defined as a minimum 5% increase in local business revenues, hotel occupancy rates, or employment in the hospitality and tourism sectors, compared to the same period in previous years without a major golf tournament. The economic impact must be confirmed by official economic reports from local government agencies or credible economic research institutions. In the absence of official reports, credible coverage from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the economic impact will suffice. Temporary or marginal increases in economic activity that do not meet the specified criteria will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a groundbreaking study in epidemiology lead to a major shift in public health policies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a groundbreaking study in epidemiology results in a significant shift in public health policies in at least one of the G7 countries (United States, United Kingdom, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan). A "groundbreaking study" is defined as research that presents novel findings with the potential to substantially alter the understanding or management of public health. A "major shift" in public health policies refers to the implementation of new policies or significant amendments to existing policies, directly attributable to the study's findings. The shift must be officially announced by the government or a recognized public health authority in the respective country. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient to confirm the policy shift. The resolution will consider only changes that have a broad impact on public health, excluding minor adjustments or policies affecting only specific groups.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) implement a policy that significantly influences social sciences research by 2025?
