Will the US House of Representatives pass significant legislation to regulate artificial intelligence by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the US House of Representatives has passed legislation that significantly regulates artificial intelligence (AI) in any of the following areas: development, deployment, ethical use, privacy, security, or bias mitigation. 

Significant legislation is defined as a bill that introduces new regulations or substantially amends existing regulations on AI. The bill must be passed by the US House of Representatives and must not be solely symbolic; it must have practical implications for the regulation of AI. 

The passage of the legislation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the criteria outlined above.

title: Will China lead the world in quantum computing research by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, China is recognized as the global leader in quantum computing research. Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:

- Publication Volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.
- Citation Impact: Chinese publications in quantum computing must have the highest citation impact, indicating significant influence on the field.
- Technological Breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.

Recognition of China's leadership position must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum, or the annual reports of the National Quantum Initiative or the European Quantum Flagship program.

In the event of a tie in any of the criteria above, additional factors such as international awards in quantum computing, or leadership in international quantum computing collaborations, may be considered.

title: Will Scott Alexander publish a groundbreaking paper on algorithmic game theory by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Scott Alexander (author of the Slate Star Codex and Astral Codex Ten blogs) has published a paper on algorithmic game theory that is recognized as groundbreaking by the academic community. A paper is considered "groundbreaking" if it introduces novel concepts, methods, or applications that significantly advance the field of algorithmic game theory, and is:

- Published in a peer-reviewed academic journal of high repute in the fields of computer science, mathematics, or economics.
- Cited by at least 50 unique academic works within two years of its publication.

In the absence of direct academic consensus, recognition by major organizations in the relevant fields (e.g., the Association for Computing Machinery, the American Mathematical Society, or the Economic Science Association) will be considered sufficient. The paper must be authored or co-authored by Scott Alexander and must explicitly contribute to the field of algorithmic game theory. Preprints, blog posts, or non-peer-reviewed publications do not qualify.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Russo-Ukrainian War has directly led to significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies. Significant advancements are defined as:
- The development and deployment of new cybersecurity technologies or methodologies that represent a substantial improvement over existing capabilities.
- The adoption of these technologies or methodologies by major governments, corporations, or cybersecurity organizations.

Advancements must be directly attributable to the challenges or experiences derived from the Russo-Ukrainian War, as evidenced by:
- Official announcements or documentation from cybersecurity firms, governments, or international cybersecurity organizations.
- Coverage in at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or publications in peer-reviewed cybersecurity journals.

In the absence of direct evidence linking advancements to the war, the question will resolve as No. Temporary or incremental improvements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will robotics achieve a major breakthrough in autonomous vehicle technology by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in autonomous vehicle technology is achieved, defined as:

- The development and successful public demonstration of an autonomous vehicle capable of navigating complex urban environments without human intervention, with a success rate of at least 95%.
- The breakthrough must be recognized by a leading industry body or consortium in the field of robotics or autonomous vehicles, such as the Association for Advancing Automation (A3) or the International Federation of Robotics (IFR).

The breakthrough must be documented in at least two reputable technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, Science Daily) or in peer-reviewed scientific journals. 

In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the resolution will be based on the first documented instance meeting the above criteria. 

Developments that only incrementally improve existing technologies without demonstrating a significant leap in capabilities will not be considered a major breakthrough for the purpose of this question.

title: Will a new technology emerge by 2025 that significantly improves the detection and treatment of infectious diseases?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new technology has emerged that significantly improves the detection and treatment of infectious diseases. Significant improvement is defined as:
- A reduction in detection time by at least 50% compared to the best available technology as of 2023.
- An increase in detection accuracy to at least 95%.
- A treatment method that reduces recovery time by at least 30% or increases the survival rate of severe cases by at least 20%, compared to the best available treatments as of 2023.
The emergence of such technology must be confirmed by the publication of results in at least two peer-reviewed scientific journals or an official announcement from a recognized health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC). Technologies that are only in the trial phase by the resolution date do not count. In the event of multiple technologies emerging, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

title: Will NATO expand to include any new member countries by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) officially expands to include one or more new member countries. Expansion is defined as the formal acceptance and ratification of a new member country's accession by existing NATO members, as confirmed by an official NATO announcement. For clarity, a 'new member country' refers to any sovereign state that is not a NATO member as of the date of this question and subsequently becomes one. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of expansion. The question will resolve as No if no such expansion occurs by the specified date.

title: Will a new infectious disease emerge with a global infection rate exceeding 1% before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a new infectious disease emerges with a global infection rate exceeding 1% of the world's population. The infection rate must be confirmed by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). For the purpose of this question, a "new infectious disease" refers to a pathogen not previously identified in humans before the date of this question. The global infection rate is defined as the percentage of the world's population confirmed to be infected by the disease, as reported by the WHO or CDC. In the absence of direct reports from these organizations, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. In the event of conflicting reports, the average of the reported rates from these sources will be used to determine the resolution. This question does not consider the severity of the disease or the death rate, focusing solely on the infection rate.

title: Will significant advancements in climatology lead to a major shift in global climate policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, significant advancements in climatology result in a major shift in global climate policy. A "significant advancement" in climatology is defined as a breakthrough in climate science that leads to a new understanding of climate systems, significantly improves climate models, or provides novel solutions to climate change. A "major shift" in global climate policy is defined as the adoption of new, substantial climate policies or amendments to existing policies by at least three of the following entities: the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the European Union, the United States, China, and India. These policies must represent a significant departure from current strategies and aim to substantially reduce greenhouse gas emissions or enhance climate resilience. The shift must be confirmed by official documentation from the relevant entities or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

title: Will Canada introduce a new digital privacy law by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Canada has officially introduced a new digital privacy law. The introduction of such a law must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The law must be enacted and come into force, not merely proposed or in draft form. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., applicable only to certain provinces or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes if the law is intended for nationwide application.

title: Will a landmark legal case involving AI ethics be adjudicated by the Supreme Court before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States adjudicates a case that is widely recognized as a landmark in the field of AI ethics. A "landmark case" is defined as one that sets a significant legal precedent or substantially influences the development of laws and regulations governing artificial intelligence and its applications. The case must directly address ethical issues related to AI, such as algorithmic bias, data privacy, autonomous decision-making, or the rights of AI entities. The resolution will be based on official court documents and must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Guardian). In the event that multiple cases are adjudicated, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first case meeting these criteria. In the absence of such a case, the question resolves as No.

title: Will a major environmental lawsuit against a global corporation be won in a US court by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major environmental lawsuit is won against a global corporation in a United States court. A "major environmental lawsuit" is defined as a legal case that addresses significant environmental harm, including but not limited to pollution, deforestation, wildlife endangerment, or climate change impacts, and involves a claim exceeding $100 million USD in damages or remediation costs. The case must be against a corporation that operates in multiple countries. The lawsuit must result in a final judgment or settlement in favor of the plaintiffs. The resolution will be based on official court documents or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple qualifying lawsuits, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first case meeting these criteria.

title: Will Taiwan pass a new digital privacy law that aligns with the European Union's GDPR standards by 2025?
Will a landmark legal case in the sports industry, specifically involving basketball, set a new precedent for athlete contracts by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a legal case in the basketball industry results in a decision or settlement that establishes a new precedent for athlete contracts. The case must involve either professional or collegiate basketball and must lead to a significant change in contract structure, compensation, athlete rights, or team obligations. The new precedent must be recognized by a major sports law authority or lead to widespread adoption across the league(s) involved. Confirmation of the precedent can come from official league announcements, legal documentation, or coverage by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic). Cases that only affect individual contracts without broader implications for the industry do not meet this criterion.

title: Will China implement a comprehensive legal framework for regulating artificial intelligence by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, China has officially implemented a comprehensive legal framework for the regulation of artificial intelligence (AI). The framework must cover at least the following areas: 
- Ethical use of AI
- Data privacy and protection
- AI in public surveillance
- Autonomous vehicles
- AI in healthcare
The implementation of such a framework must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 
For the purpose of this question, a "comprehensive legal framework" is defined as a set of laws or regulations that collectively address the ethical, social, economic, and technical aspects of AI deployment and use across multiple sectors. 
In the event of partial implementation (e.g., regulations covering only certain sectors), the question will resolve as No unless the missing sectors are explicitly stated to be covered in a subsequent phase of implementation.

title: Will Brazil achieve a 20% reduction in deforestation rates by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Brazil has achieved a 20% reduction in deforestation rates compared to the baseline year of 2020. The deforestation rates will be measured by the official data published by the Brazilian National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or its successor organization. The measurement will be based on the annual deforestation rates reported in the Amazon region, which is the primary focus of deforestation monitoring in Brazil. In the event that INPE or its successor organization ceases to exist or does not publish annual deforestation data, this question will resolve based on data from a comparable authoritative source, such as the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) or the World Resources Institute (WRI). Should there be significant discrepancies between sources, the resolution will consider a consensus of these reports. Temporary fluctuations in deforestation rates that do not reflect a sustained reduction over the five-year period do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Taiwan introduce a new policy to reduce plastic waste by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Taiwan has officially introduced a new policy aimed at reducing plastic waste. The policy must be aimed at significantly reducing the production, use, or disposal of plastic materials across the country. This includes, but is not limited to, bans on certain types of single-use plastics, incentives for recycling, or regulations that mandate reductions in plastic packaging. The introduction of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be enacted and in force, not merely proposed or under consideration. Temporary measures or policies with limited scope (e.g., specific to certain cities or regions) do not count towards this question's resolution unless they are explicitly part of a national strategy to reduce plastic waste.

title: Will Google achieve carbon neutrality in its global operations by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google has officially achieved carbon neutrality in its global operations. Carbon neutrality must be verified by an independent, reputable third-party organization recognized for environmental or carbon accounting standards. The achievement must encompass all of Google's operations worldwide, including data centers, offices, and any other facilities. The verification process should confirm that Google has effectively balanced its carbon emissions by reducing them to net zero through a combination of emissions reduction efforts and investment in renewable energy or carbon offset projects. In the absence of a direct announcement from Google, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the achievement. Temporary or partial achievements, such as carbon neutrality for a single sector of operations or for a limited time period, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency be named after a cricket term by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a cryptocurrency that is ranked within the top 100 by market capitalization according to a recognized cryptocurrency market analysis platform (e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko) is named after a cricket term. The term must be widely recognized within the cricket community and must directly relate to the sport (e.g., "Wicket", "Bowler", "Century"). The naming of the cryptocurrency must be intentional, with clear references to its cricket-related origin in its official documentation or announcements by its creators. In the event of multiple cryptocurrencies meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them is within the top 100 by market capitalization. This question resolves as NO if no such cryptocurrency exists by the specified date.

title: Will the value of Bitcoin exceed the US dollar in terms of global transaction volume by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the total global transaction volume of Bitcoin exceeds that of the US dollar. The transaction volume must be confirmed by data from authoritative financial tracking organizations or databases, such as the Bank for International Settlements (BIS), International Monetary Fund (IMF), or other recognized financial institutions. The comparison will consider the total volume of transactions processed within the calendar year 2030, including but not limited to retail transactions, cross-border transactions, and institutional transfers. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the majority consensus among these authoritative sources will be used to determine the outcome. Temporary spikes in transaction volume due to speculative trading or singular events will not be considered. The resolution will be based on the most reliable and comprehensive data available as of December 31, 2030.

title: Will Australia introduce a national cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Australia has officially introduced a national cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and regulated by the Australian government as a legal tender for the country. The introduction of such a cryptocurrency must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial introduction (e.g., limited to specific states or territories), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for nationwide use. Pilot programs or digital currencies limited to specific applications (e.g., interbank settlements) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom launch a new national health initiative to combat future pandemics by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Kingdom has officially launched a new national health initiative aimed at combating future pandemics. The initiative must be comprehensive, addressing at least prevention, detection, and response strategies for future pandemics. It must be officially announced by the UK government or a relevant health authority. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The initiative must be new, not an extension or rebranding of existing programs. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or aspects of pandemic preparedness), the question will resolve as Yes if the initiative is intended for nationwide application.

title: Will a major ethical controversy in medical research lead to global policy changes in health care by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major ethical controversy in medical research leads to the implementation of new global health care policies or significant amendments to existing ones. A "major ethical controversy" is defined as an event or series of events in medical research that raises significant ethical concerns, receives widespread coverage in at least five reputable international news outlets (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters), and prompts a response from international health organizations (e.g., World Health Organization) or coalitions of nations. The new or amended policies must be aimed at addressing the ethical concerns raised and must be adopted by at least 50% of the member states of the World Health Organization. The resolution will consider only policies that have been officially announced and documented by the relevant governing bodies. In the event of multiple controversies, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria.

title: Will Amazon engage in a significant geopolitical initiative by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially announced or is credibly reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) to have engaged in a significant geopolitical initiative. A "significant geopolitical initiative" is defined as any action or series of actions by Amazon that significantly influences the policies, economy, or diplomatic relations of one or more countries. This may include, but is not limited to, major investments in infrastructure with strategic importance, entering into agreements with governments that have a substantial impact on trade policies, or initiatives that significantly affect geopolitical stability or alignments. The initiative must be beyond Amazon's usual business operations and have a clear geopolitical impact. In the event of ambiguous cases, the consensus among the cited news organizations will be considered for resolution. Temporary or minor engagements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major geopolitical event significantly impact international soccer tournaments by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted the scheduling, location, participation, or overall execution of international soccer tournaments.

A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the government or military actions of one or more countries, leading to widespread international reactions or sanctions. Examples include, but are not limited to, wars, significant diplomatic disputes, economic sanctions, or major political changes.

The impact on soccer tournaments must be confirmed by FIFA or UEFA through official announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will resolve as No if no such events or impacts are confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will the NFL host a game in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) has officially hosted a regular season or playoff game in a country that, at the time of the game, is under international sanctions by the United Nations, the European Union, the United States, or any other major international body. The game must be part of the official NFL season schedule, and not a pre-season or exhibition game. Confirmation must come from an official NFL announcement or credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event that sanctions are lifted on a country after the announcement of the game but before the game itself, the question will still resolve as Yes if the sanctions were in place at the time of the announcement. Temporary or partial sanctions specifically targeting individuals or entities within the country do not qualify; the sanctions must be country-wide.

title: Will the NFL implement policies to significantly reduce concussions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the National Football League (NFL) has officially implemented one or more new policies aimed at significantly reducing the incidence of concussions among players. Significant reduction is defined as a decrease of at least 20% in the reported cases of concussions during the regular season compared to the average of the previous five years, as reported by the NFL's official health and safety reports or recognized medical research publications. The implementation of such policies must be confirmed by an official NFL announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. Temporary measures or policies applied only in pre-season or for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will France experience a major social movement leading to significant policy changes by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has experienced a major social movement that leads to significant policy changes. A "major social movement" is defined as a widespread mobilization of people across multiple cities, recognized by major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Le Monde, France24) and involving at least 100,000 participants in total. "Significant policy changes" refer to legislative or executive actions that alter national policy in at least one of the following areas: labor laws, environmental regulations, social welfare, or civil rights. The changes must be directly attributable to the social movement and recognized as such by at least two of the aforementioned news organizations. In the event of multiple movements, the question resolves as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria. Temporary or symbolic measures do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major aerospace company announce a breakthrough in environmentally sustainable aviation technology by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major aerospace company (defined as a company with a significant share in the global aerospace market, such as Boeing, Airbus, Lockheed Martin, or equivalent) announces a breakthrough in environmentally sustainable aviation technology. The breakthrough must represent a significant advancement in reducing the environmental impact of aviation, such as a new propulsion system, fuel efficiency improvement, or emissions reduction technology. The announcement must be confirmed through an official press release by the company or coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple announcements, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Temporary or experimental technologies not intended for commercial use do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Elon Musk's companies contribute to a significant breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of Elon Musk's companies (including but not limited to SpaceX, Tesla, Inc., Neuralink, and The Boring Company) have contributed to a significant breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that leads to a demonstrable and substantial improvement in nuclear fusion technology, such as achieving net energy gain from a fusion reaction, substantial reduction in the cost of fusion energy production, or a major advancement in fusion reactor design. The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, with confirmation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement by a major scientific organization. In the absence of direct publication or announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The contribution by Elon Musk's companies must be direct and significant, playing a key role in the achievement of the breakthrough.

title: Will a new astronomical object with implications for nuclear technology be discovered by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new astronomical object is discovered that has implications for nuclear technology. The discovery must be confirmed by observations from recognized astronomical organizations or observatories (e.g., NASA, ESA, ESO) and must have a direct and significant impact on the development or understanding of nuclear technology. The implications for nuclear technology must be detailed in a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official report by a recognized scientific or technological institution. The discovery must be of an object outside the Earth-Moon system. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Discoveries that only indirectly affect nuclear technology through broad scientific advancements do not meet this question's resolution criteria.

title: Will there be a major nuclear accident reported in the news by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major nuclear accident is reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). A "major nuclear accident" is defined as an event classified at Level 5 or above on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES), indicating wider consequences beyond the immediate site of the incident. The accident must be confirmed by official sources or through detailed reporting by the aforementioned news organizations. In the event of conflicting reports about the severity of the incident, the question will resolve based on the consensus of coverage by the specified news organizations. Temporary safety incidents or events classified below Level 5 on the INES do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant discovery in particle physics be made through computational methods by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in particle physics is made through computational methods. A "significant discovery" is defined as a discovery that leads to a substantial revision of the Standard Model of particle physics, or provides empirical evidence for phenomena not predicted by the Standard Model, such as supersymmetry, extra dimensions, or dark matter interactions.

The discovery must be confirmed through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact (e.g., Nature, Science, Physical Review Letters) and must be recognized by a leading scientific organization in the field of particle physics (e.g., CERN, Fermilab, International Particle Physics Outreach Group).

Computational methods include, but are not limited to, simulations, data analysis algorithms, and machine learning techniques. The use of computational methods must be central to the discovery, not merely supplementary.

In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

title: Will a new algorithm significantly improve the efficiency of medical data analysis by 2030?
body: A "new algorithm" refers to a novel computational method or process, distinct from existing algorithms as of 2023, that enhances the efficiency of analyzing medical data. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new algorithm is developed and publicly documented to significantly improve the efficiency of medical data analysis in terms of speed, accuracy, or cost reduction. The improvement must be quantifiable, with at least a 20% increase in efficiency compared to the best-known methods as of 2023. The algorithm must be validated through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific or medical journal, or through widespread adoption by at least three leading healthcare institutions or companies. In the event of multiple algorithms being developed, the question will resolve as Yes if any one algorithm meets these criteria. The term "significant improvement" is defined as a measurable and substantial enhancement in processing speed, accuracy, or cost-effectiveness in the analysis of medical data, which could include patient records, imaging data, genetic information, or other relevant medical datasets.

title: Will Japan lead the development of a groundbreaking computing technology by 2030?
Will Australia commission a new nuclear power plant by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Australia has officially commissioned a new nuclear power plant. Commissioning in this context means that the plant has been officially declared operational by the Australian government or the responsible regulatory body. The plant must be capable of generating nuclear energy for public or industrial use. The commissioning of the plant must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The plant must not only be in a trial phase but fully operational. In the event of a delay, the question will resolve as No unless the plant has been officially declared operational before the resolution date.

title: Will OpenAI develop an AI model capable of predicting nuclear accidents before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, OpenAI has developed and publicly announced an artificial intelligence model that is capable of predicting nuclear accidents. The model must demonstrate a predictive accuracy of at least 80% in identifying potential nuclear accidents before they occur. The prediction model must be validated by at least two independent organizations specializing in nuclear safety or artificial intelligence research. The announcement of the development of such a model must be confirmed through official OpenAI channels or credible news sources, including but not limited to BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, and Reuters. In the event that OpenAI merges with, is acquired by, or otherwise becomes part of another entity, the question will resolve as Yes if the successor entity meets the criteria set forth above.

title: Will advancements in string theory lead to a breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, advancements in string theory have directly contributed to a significant breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that enables a nuclear fusion reactor to achieve and maintain net positive energy output for at least 24 continuous hours. The breakthrough must be attributable to theoretical or practical applications of string theory, as confirmed by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement from a leading nuclear fusion research institution (e.g., ITER, National Ignition Facility, or similar). In the absence of direct evidence linking the breakthrough to string theory, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must represent a substantial improvement over current capabilities and not merely an incremental advancement.

title: Will the US Congress pass a major electoral reform bill before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the US Congress passes a major electoral reform bill. A "major electoral reform bill" is defined as legislation that includes significant changes to at least two of the following areas: voting methods, redistricting processes, campaign finance regulations, or voter registration processes. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States. For the purposes of this question, "significant changes" are those that alter the legal framework in a way that could reasonably be expected to have a substantial impact on electoral outcomes or voter participation. The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation of the bill's provisions (e.g., if certain sections are not enacted or are delayed), the question will resolve as Yes only if the implemented sections include significant changes to at least two of the areas mentioned above.

title: Will a significant electoral reform be implemented in any country as a result of a major food safety scandal before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a significant electoral reform is implemented in any country directly as a result of a major food safety scandal. A "significant electoral reform" is defined as a change in the electoral system or voting process that affects national elections and is recognized as such by the country's government or a reputable international organization. A "major food safety scandal" must involve widespread public health impact, significant economic loss, or substantial political fallout, and must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). The causal link between the food safety scandal and the electoral reform must be clearly established by credible sources. In the absence of direct evidence, a consensus among political analysts reported in reputable media may suffice. Temporary measures or reforms limited to local elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major epidemic influence the outcome of a national election in any country before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major epidemic significantly influences the outcome of a national election in any country. A "major epidemic" is defined as an outbreak of disease that results in significant morbidity or mortality, receives widespread national or international media coverage, and is officially declared an epidemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the national health authority of the country in question. The influence on the election outcome must be clearly attributable to the epidemic, such as through a significant shift in public opinion, voter turnout, or the implementation of election-related policies (e.g., mail-in voting, election postponement). The determination of significant influence will be based on analysis from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or academic publications. In the event of multiple epidemics influencing elections in different countries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified instance.

title: Will a landmark legal case involving immunology be adjudicated by the Supreme Court before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States adjudicates a landmark legal case involving immunology. A "landmark legal case" is defined as a case that sets a precedent, significantly affects the interpretation of law, or has substantial national implications in the field of immunology. The case must directly involve issues related to immunology, such as vaccine mandates, immunotherapy patent disputes, or the legal status of immunological research practices. Resolution will be based on official Supreme Court documents or announcements. In the absence of such documents, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. Cases that are remanded to lower courts without a substantive ruling on the issues of immunology will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant legal discovery in astronomy lead to a new international space law by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant legal discovery in the field of astronomy leads to the establishment of a new international space law. A "significant legal discovery" refers to a finding or development that necessitates the creation or significant amendment of international legal frameworks governing space exploration, use, or security. The new law must be officially adopted by an international governing body recognized for space affairs, such as the United Nations Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space (COPUOS) or an equivalent entity. The adoption of the law must be documented by official records or announcements from the governing body. In the absence of direct documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The law must address the discovery directly and be intended for implementation by member states. This question resolves as YES upon the official adoption of such a law.

title: Will the US Congress pass a major law reforming the judicial system before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the US Congress passes a major law that significantly reforms the judicial system. A "major law" is defined as legislation that enacts substantial changes in the structure, powers, or processes of the federal judicial system, including but not limited to the Supreme Court, federal courts of appeal, and district courts. 

Substantial changes may include alterations in the appointment process of judges, changes in the jurisdiction of courts, significant modifications in the procedural rules governing litigation, or the introduction of measures aimed at increasing the transparency or accountability of the judiciary. 

The passage of the law must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are passed that collectively constitute a major reform, this question will resolve as Yes.

title: Will an NBA player break the single-game scoring record by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an NBA player breaks the current single-game scoring record of 100 points, set by Wilt Chamberlain on March 2, 1962. The new record must be officially recognized by the National Basketball Association (NBA) and must occur during a regular season or playoff game. Exhibition, pre-season, and All-Star games are excluded. The game in which the record is broken must be completed under the NBA's official rules without any disqualifications that could affect the game's outcome or the record's validity. In the event of a tie, where multiple players break the record in the same game, the question will resolve as Yes. If the record is broken in a game that is later voided or the results are officially altered for any reason by the NBA, the question will not resolve as Yes.

title: Will a major Hollywood movie about Scott Alexander's work be announced by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major Hollywood studio officially announces the development of a movie based on the work of Scott Alexander. The announcement must specify that the movie will adapt or be inspired by Alexander's writings, theories, or contributions to the field of psychiatry, psychology, or rationality. The studio must be recognized as a major Hollywood entity, such as those belonging to the Motion Picture Association (MPA). Confirmation of the announcement must come directly from the studio or through credible news sources, including but not limited to BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, and The Washington Post. In the event of an unofficial leak or rumor, the question will resolve as Yes only if the studio subsequently confirms the project within 30 days. Projects announced as 'in development' count towards this question's resolution, provided they meet the above criteria. Adaptations of Alexander's work by independent studios, documentaries, or television series do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will biotechnology significantly enhance athlete performance in any major sports league by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any major sports league (e.g., NBA, FIFA, NFL, MLB, NHL) officially recognizes the use of biotechnology as a significant factor in enhancing athlete performance. Significant enhancement includes, but is not limited to, increased physical endurance, strength, recovery speed, or agility, as confirmed by scientific studies or statistical evidence. The recognition must come from the league's governing body or an official statement from the league. In the absence of official recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN) confirming the widespread use of biotechnology for performance enhancement in the league will suffice. Temporary or experimental use in minor leagues or individual teams does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Nations announce a new global initiative to combat climate change by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations has officially announced a new global initiative specifically aimed at combating climate change. The initiative must represent a significant commitment beyond existing programs and must be aimed at reducing global carbon emissions, promoting renewable energy, or enhancing climate resilience. The announcement must come from an official UN source or be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of an announcement close to the resolution date, the initiative must be clearly defined and have a planned implementation timeline. Initiatives that are purely exploratory, lack specific goals, or are limited to funding research without actionable plans do not meet the criteria for resolution.

title: Will a major breakthrough in biotechnology significantly reduce carbon emissions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in biotechnology is officially recognized as having significantly reduced global carbon emissions. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development in biotechnology that leads to a reduction in global carbon emissions by at least 10% compared to the year 2020 levels, as reported by the International Energy Agency (IEA) or an equivalent authoritative body. The breakthrough must be in the field of biotechnology, including but not limited to, genetic engineering, microbial fuel cells, algae biofuels, or carbon capture and storage technologies. The reduction in emissions must be directly attributable to the application of the biotechnology, and not a result of external factors such as economic downturns or reductions in industrial activity. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution. In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community, as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals, will be considered.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention publish a comprehensive report on the health impacts of climate change by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has published a comprehensive report on the health impacts of climate change. The report must cover a wide range of health impacts directly and indirectly related to climate change, including but not limited to: - Changes in the distribution and prevalence of vector-borne diseases; - Impacts on mental health and well-being; - Effects on air quality and respiratory health; - The influence of extreme weather events on public health. The report must be publicly accessible and recognized by the CDC as comprehensive in its coverage of climate change's health impacts. In the absence of a single comprehensive report, a series of publications by the CDC that collectively cover the criteria above will also satisfy the resolution criteria. The resolution will rely on official CDC announcements or publications. In the event that the CDC has not published such a report by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will a quantum computing breakthrough lead to a significant advancement in solving complex natural science problems by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in quantum computing results in a significant advancement in solving complex natural science problems, such as those in physics, chemistry, biology, or earth sciences. A "significant advancement" is defined as a solution or substantial progress on a problem that has been widely recognized as unsolved or intractable with classical computing methods. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or recognized by a leading scientific organization or consortium. In the absence of a single defining event, a consensus among experts in the field, as reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), will be considered sufficient evidence. The advancement must be directly attributable to the capabilities of quantum computing, rather than incremental improvements in classical computing or other technologies.

title: Will a significant discovery in the field of natural sciences be influenced by research funded by the Virginia Department of Health by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in the field of natural sciences is officially recognized as being influenced by research funded by the Virginia Department of Health. A "significant discovery" is defined as one that leads to a major advancement in understanding, technology, or application in any area of the natural sciences, including but not limited to biology, chemistry, physics, and earth sciences. The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or recognized by a major scientific award. The influence of the Virginia Department of Health's funding must be explicitly acknowledged in the publication or award announcement. In the absence of such acknowledgment, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the funding's critical role are sufficient. This question resolves as YES upon such recognition; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

title: Will Amazon's involvement in cloud computing significantly accelerate research in the natural sciences by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is significant acceleration in research within the natural sciences attributed to Amazon's involvement in cloud computing. Significant acceleration is defined as a measurable increase in the number of published research papers, the development of new research technologies, or the enhancement of research efficiency in fields such as biology, chemistry, physics, earth science, and environmental science. The acceleration must be directly linked to Amazon's cloud computing services, platforms, or initiatives. Verification will be based on reports or studies from reputable scientific organizations, academic publications, or major technology and science news outlets (e.g., Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum). In the absence of direct reports, a consensus among experts in the field, as evidenced by quotes or studies published in major scientific journals or media, will suffice. The question will resolve as No if such acceleration cannot be conclusively demonstrated by the specified date.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in social engineering techniques that influence public behavior by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in social engineering techniques that has a demonstrable and measurable impact on influencing public behavior is announced. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a new method or improvement of existing techniques that leads to a substantial change in public behavior, attitudes, or beliefs on a large scale. The breakthrough must be documented in at least one of the following: - A peer-reviewed scientific journal. - An official report by a recognized governmental or international organization. - Coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The impact of the breakthrough must be measurable through surveys, studies, or statistical analysis demonstrating a significant change in public behavior, attitudes, or beliefs. In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. Temporary or localized effects do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new social science theory emerge by 2030 that significantly improves our understanding of immune system-related behaviors?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new social science theory has emerged that significantly improves our understanding of immune system-related behaviors. The theory must be recognized and validated by the scientific community, specifically within the fields of psychology, sociology, or anthropology. Significant improvement in understanding is defined as a theory that leads to new research directions, methodologies, or interventions that are demonstrably effective in understanding or modifying immune system-related behaviors. The emergence of the theory must be documented in at least one peer-reviewed journal within the social sciences and cited by other scholars in subsequent research. In the absence of a single defining publication, a consensus among experts in the field, as evidenced by a special issue in a reputable journal or a dedicated session in a major social science conference, may also suffice. This question resolves as YES upon the publication of such a theory or the consensus of experts, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

title: Will Spain introduce a new policy to regulate the operation of electric vehicle companies like Tesla by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Spain has officially introduced a new policy or set of regulations specifically aimed at governing the operation of electric vehicle (EV) companies, including but not limited to Tesla, within its jurisdiction. The policy must address at least one of the following areas: vehicle sales, charging infrastructure, environmental standards, or operational licensing for EV companies. The introduction of such a policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be enacted and in force, not merely proposed or under consideration. In the event of a regional policy (e.g., limited to specific autonomous communities or cities) that is intended for national adoption, the question will resolve as Yes. Policies that are part of broader EU directives but specifically implemented by Spain also count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will FIFA introduce a global health initiative to combat pandemics affecting international sports events by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially announced and initiated a global health initiative aimed at combating pandemics that affect international sports events. The initiative must be designed to prevent, manage, or mitigate the impact of pandemics on the organization and execution of international sports events, including but not limited to football matches and tournaments.

The announcement of such an initiative must be confirmed through official FIFA communication channels, such as press releases, official statements, or documented meetings. In the absence of direct communication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence.

The initiative must include specific measures or programs that are actionable and measurable, and it must be aimed at a global scale, not limited to specific regions or countries. Temporary measures or initiatives solely for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a breakthrough in aerospace engineering lead to a significant improvement in global pandemic response capabilities by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in aerospace engineering has led to a significant improvement in global pandemic response capabilities. A "significant improvement" is defined as a development that enables at least a 30% reduction in global pandemic response time or a 20% increase in the distribution efficiency of medical supplies, vaccines, or personnel compared to 2023 standards. The breakthrough must be in the field of aerospace engineering and directly contribute to the improvement of pandemic response capabilities. This includes, but is not limited to, innovations in aircraft design, logistics, and transportation technologies that enhance the speed, efficiency, or reach of pandemic response efforts. The improvement must be documented and recognized by at least one of the following: the World Health Organization (WHO), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), or a similar authoritative public health body. In the absence of official recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or experimental deployments do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the NBA implement new health protocols to significantly reduce the spread of infectious diseases among players by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Basketball Association (NBA) has officially implemented new health protocols aimed at significantly reducing the spread of infectious diseases among players. Significant reduction is defined as a decrease in reported cases of infectious diseases among players by at least 50% compared to the average of the previous five seasons. The implementation of these protocols must be confirmed by an official NBA announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. The protocols must be in effect and not merely proposed or in a trial phase. Temporary measures for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announce a new initiative to combat a global health crisis before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially announces a new initiative aimed at combating a global health crisis. The initiative must be specifically designed to address a health issue with the potential to affect a significant portion of the global population. The announcement must be made through an official CDC press release or a public statement by a high-ranking CDC official. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The initiative must be new, not an extension or modification of existing programs. In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert opinion in the public health community.

title: Will a major political figure propose a global summit on virology research funding before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major political figure has officially proposed a global summit focused on virology research funding. A "major political figure" is defined as a current head of state, head of government, or a minister of health from any of the G20 nations. The proposal must be for a summit specifically aimed at discussing, planning, or increasing funding for virology research on a global scale. The proposal must be publicly documented through an official government press release, announcement, or in statements made during official government proceedings. In the absence of direct government documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The summit does not need to take place by the resolution date; only the proposal is necessary for the question to resolve as Yes.

title: Will a significant political agreement be reached on international nuclear research collaboration by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration is officially announced. A "significant political agreement" is defined as an agreement that involves at least three countries and includes commitments to joint research projects, funding, and sharing of nuclear technologies for peaceful purposes. The agreement must be formalized through an official treaty, memorandum of understanding, or a similar legally binding document. The countries involved must include at least one of the following: United States, Russia, China, France, or the United Kingdom. Verification of the agreement will be based on official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of an agreement that is announced but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a significant political movement or party emerge by 2030, influenced by theories or discoveries related to dark matter?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a political movement or party that explicitly cites theories or discoveries related to dark matter as a significant influence on its platform, policies, or founding principles has emerged and is recognized as significant within its national context. Significance can be determined by any of the following criteria:
- Official recognition as a political party by a national electoral commission or equivalent authority.
- Representation in a national parliament or legislative body.
- Coverage as a significant movement or party by at least three reputable international news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the astrophysical component thought to constitute most of the matter in the universe, influencing theories of cosmic structure and evolution. Theories or discoveries must be cited in official party documents, public statements by party leaders, or foundational texts.

In the event of ambiguity regarding the movement or party's influence by dark matter theories, the resolution will default to No.

title: Will a major political scandal involving misuse of information technology by a leading political party be uncovered before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major political scandal involving the misuse of information technology by a leading political party is uncovered. A "major political scandal" is defined as an event that leads to significant public outcry, legal action against the party or its members, and widespread coverage in at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). The misuse of information technology includes, but is not limited to, unauthorized data harvesting, election interference, digital espionage, and the dissemination of false information through digital platforms. The scandal must be confirmed by official investigations or credible reports from multiple major news organizations. In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus among the majority of cited reputable news sources will be considered. This question resolves as YES upon the public disclosure of such a scandal by official investigation results or credible journalistic investigation.

title: Will the integration of cricket analytics technology significantly influence team strategies in major leagues by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is significant evidence that cricket analytics technology has been integrated into team strategies in major cricket leagues (e.g., Indian Premier League, Big Bash League, Caribbean Premier League). Significant influence is defined as documented changes in team selection, batting order, bowling strategies, or field placements directly attributed to insights gained from cricket analytics technology. Confirmation must come from official league announcements, interviews with team coaches or management, or analysis in reputable sports publications (ESPN, Cricinfo, The Guardian sports section). The technology must be used in at least one full season to qualify. Temporary or trial implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the NHL implement mandatory health screenings for players to detect early signs of chronic diseases by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially implemented mandatory health screenings for all players to detect early signs of chronic diseases. The screenings must be comprehensive, covering a range of chronic diseases including but not limited to heart disease, diabetes, and neurodegenerative diseases. The implementation of such screenings must be confirmed by an official NHL announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. The screenings must be required for all players under NHL contracts, including those in the minor leagues under NHL contracts. Temporary or trial programs do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific teams or leagues), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is an official plan for league-wide implementation.

title: Will Mexico host the FIFA World Cup again before 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, it is officially announced by FIFA that Mexico will host the FIFA World Cup at any future date. The announcement must be made through official FIFA communication channels, including but not limited to press releases, official website announcements, or official social media accounts. In the absence of a direct announcement from FIFA, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the decision will also be considered sufficient for resolution. This question does not consider joint hosting arrangements where Mexico is not the primary host or if Mexico is only one of several countries hosting a fraction of the matches without being designated as the primary host country.

title: Will France win another FIFA World Cup by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the French national football team has won at least one FIFA World Cup tournament. The resolution will be based on the official results as announced by FIFA at the conclusion of the World Cup tournaments scheduled to occur before the end of 2030. In the event of a dispute or controversy regarding the outcome of a tournament, the resolution will defer to the final decision made by FIFA's governing body. This includes any decisions made regarding match outcomes, disqualifications, or any other factors that could influence the official tournament results. The question resolves as NO if France does not win any of the World Cup tournaments before the specified date.

title: Will a major sports league implement immunology-based performance enhancement protocols by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any major sports league (defined as a league with significant international recognition such as the NBA, FIFA, NFL, MLB, NHL, or their equivalent in other sports) has officially implemented protocols that utilize immunology-based methods for enhancing the performance of its athletes. These protocols must be designed to improve physical performance, recovery, or injury prevention and must be based on scientific principles of immunology. The implementation of such protocols must be confirmed by an official announcement from the league or a credible report from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN). Protocols used in a trial phase or exclusively for medical treatment unrelated to performance enhancement do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to certain teams or athletes), the question will resolve as Yes if the protocols are intended for league-wide adoption.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine be mandatory for international travel by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any form of COVID-19 vaccination is required by international law or regulation, or by the laws or regulations of at least 75% of the following countries (United States, China, India, Russia, Brazil, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy, and Japan) for entry into their territories from abroad. The requirement must apply to at least 90% of incoming travelers, regardless of nationality. Exemptions for medical reasons or proof of recovery from COVID-19 are considered part of the vaccination requirement. The resolution will be based on official government announcements, international agreements, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event that less than 75% of the listed countries implement such a requirement, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant shift in employment within the renewable energy sector by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports a significant shift in employment within the renewable energy sector in the United States. A "significant shift" is defined as an increase or decrease of at least 10% in the total number of employed individuals in the sector compared to the previous year's report. The renewable energy sector includes industries and jobs directly involved in the production, installation, and maintenance of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy. The BLS's Annual Report on Occupational Employment and Wages will be the authoritative source for this determination. In the absence of a clear report from the BLS, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The New York Times) will be considered sufficient. Temporary fluctuations due to seasonal hiring or short-term projects do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the number of golf courses implementing sustainable water management practices increase by 50% by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the number of golf courses worldwide that have implemented sustainable water management practices has increased by at least 50% compared to the number recorded as of January 1, 2021. Sustainable water management practices include, but are not limited to, the use of recycled or reclaimed water, rainwater harvesting systems, efficient irrigation technology, and drought-resistant landscaping. Verification must come from credible sources such as the Global Golf Environment Organization (GEO), the United States Golf Association (USGA), or equivalent national and international bodies. In the absence of comprehensive global data, a representative sample from major golfing countries (USA, UK, Japan, South Korea, and Australia) may be used to infer global trends. The increase must be net, accounting for both new adoptions and any discontinuations of sustainable practices.

title: Will an athlete competing in the Olympics break a world record in a natural sciences-related event by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an athlete competing in the Olympic Games breaks a world record in an event that is directly related to the natural sciences. For the purpose of this question, a "natural sciences-related event" is defined as any Olympic event that requires a demonstration of principles of physics, chemistry, biology, or earth sciences in order to achieve a record-breaking performance. This includes, but is not limited to, events in archery (physics of trajectory), sailing (aerodynamics and fluid dynamics), and shooting (ballistics). The breaking of the world record must be officially recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the relevant international sports federation. In the event of a dispute over the classification of an event as "natural sciences-related," the resolution will default to the consensus of the scientific community. This question resolves as YES upon official confirmation of the record by the IOC and the relevant sports federation.

title: Will a major breakthrough in pharmacology be announced that significantly extends human lifespan by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in pharmacology is announced that significantly extends human lifespan. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a pharmacological discovery or development that is scientifically proven to extend the average human lifespan by at least 10 years. The breakthrough must be documented in at least one of the following: 
- A publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact. 
- An official announcement from a leading health organization (e.g., World Health Organization, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Institutes of Health). 
For the purpose of this question, "significantly extends human lifespan" refers to the extension of life expectancy at birth. The announcement must be supported by clinical trial results that demonstrate the efficacy of the pharmacological intervention in humans. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 
In the event of multiple announcements, the question will resolve based on the first announcement that meets these criteria.

title: Will the United States announce a major scientific discovery in the field of natural sciences by 2025?
