body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States officially announces a major scientific discovery in the field of natural sciences. A "major scientific discovery" is defined as a finding that significantly advances our understanding or application in one or more of the following areas: astronomy, biology, chemistry, earth science, or physics. The announcement must come from a recognized U.S. scientific organization or agency (e.g., NASA, National Science Foundation, U.S. Geological Survey) and be widely reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Nature, Science). In the absence of a single defining announcement, a consensus among the scientific community, as evidenced by publications in multiple peer-reviewed scientific journals or presentations at major scientific conferences, will also satisfy this criterion. The discovery must be new, not a development or extension of existing knowledge. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will the value of the US dollar significantly influence global renewable energy investments by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant influence of the US dollar value on global renewable energy investments. A "significant influence" is defined as a documented change of at least 10% in the total global investment in renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass) directly attributed to fluctuations in the US dollar value. This must be confirmed by data or reports from at least two of the following authoritative sources: International Energy Agency (IEA), World Bank, Bloomberg New Energy Finance, or similar reputable organizations. In the absence of direct reports, credible analyses from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) that link changes in renewable energy investments to the US dollar value will also be considered sufficient. The analysis must clearly differentiate the impact of the US dollar from other factors influencing renewable energy investments.

title: Will a major golf tournament commit to achieving carbon neutrality by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any of the four major golf tournaments (The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or PGA Championship) officially commits to achieving carbon neutrality. The commitment must include a detailed plan for achieving carbon neutrality in operations, including but not limited to energy use, transportation, and waste management. The plan must be publicly available and endorsed by the tournament's organizing body. Verification will be based on official announcements or documentation from the tournament's organizing body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN) are sufficient. Temporary or partial commitments, such as for a single edition of the tournament, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant shift in environmental philosophy influencing global climate policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant shift in environmental philosophy that influences global climate policy. A "significant shift" is defined as the adoption of a new or substantially revised environmental philosophy that leads to the implementation of new global climate policies or the amendment of existing ones. This shift must be recognized and reported by at least three major international organizations involved in climate change (e.g., United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, World Meteorological Organization) or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The new or revised philosophy must lead to actionable policy changes at the international level, such as new global agreements, significant amendments to existing treaties, or the establishment of new global climate goals. The resolution will consider the consensus of the scientific community and authoritative sources on the matter. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the preponderance of evidence from the specified sources.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant bill regarding foreign policy towards Iran before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that significantly alters the United States' foreign policy towards Iran. A bill will be considered significant if it involves substantial changes in trade, military, diplomatic relations, or sanctions. The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, The Washington Post) are sufficient. The bill must be passed by the House of Representatives and not merely proposed or discussed. In the event of a veto by the President, the question will resolve as Yes only if the veto is overridden.

title: Will a major geopolitical event significantly impact global health security by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted global health security. A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the military, political, or economic actions of one or more countries that have a widespread impact on global stability or international relations. The impact on "global health security" must be significant, affecting international health regulations, causing widespread health crises (e.g., pandemics, significant increases in mortality rates, or major disruptions to healthcare systems), or leading to substantial changes in global health policy. The event and its impact on global health security must be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official statements from international health organizations (WHO, CDC). In the absence of direct evidence, a consensus among experts in international relations and global health, as reported by the aforementioned sources, will be considered sufficient. The resolution will consider the direct and immediate effects of the geopolitical event, not long-term consequences that unfold over years.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health introduce a blockchain-based system for health records management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Virginia Department of Health has officially introduced a blockchain-based system for managing health records. The system must be fully operational and utilized for storing, accessing, or sharing health records within the state's health system. An official announcement from the Virginia Department of Health or credible documentation must confirm the deployment of the system. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The system must demonstrate the use of blockchain technology for enhancing security, privacy, and efficiency in health records management. Temporary or pilot projects do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will California implement a state-backed cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the state of California has officially implemented a state-backed cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and regulated by an official state authority, such as the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation, and must be designed for use as a legal tender within the state. Implementation is defined as the cryptocurrency being publicly available for use in transactions and recognized by the state for tax payments or other governmental fees. Confirmation of implementation must come from an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific sectors or regions), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for statewide use.

title: Will the NHL adopt a cryptocurrency as a form of payment for merchandise and tickets by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially adopted one or more cryptocurrencies as a form of payment for purchasing merchandise and tickets. The adoption must be confirmed through an official NHL announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic, CBC Sports, TSN) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency payment option must be available directly through NHL platforms or authorized vendors and must be operational, not in a trial phase. Temporary promotions or limited-time offers do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Formula 1 significantly contribute to the advancement of electric vehicle technology by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Formula 1 has made a significant contribution to the advancement of electric vehicle (EV) technology. Significant contribution is defined as any of the following:
- The development and implementation of new EV technologies or systems that are adopted by at least two major automobile manufacturers for use in consumer vehicles.
- The introduction of regulations or standards by Formula 1 that result in a measurable improvement in the performance, efficiency, or safety of electric vehicles, as reported by a reputable automotive or technology publication.
- Direct involvement in the development of electric powertrains, battery technologies, or other EV-specific components that lead to a breakthrough in EV technology, as recognized by a major automotive industry award or a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

In the absence of direct evidence, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the contribution. The advancement must be clearly attributable to Formula 1's involvement or innovation.

title: Will a major breakthrough in particle physics lead to a new economic industry by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a major breakthrough in particle physics has led to the establishment of a new economic industry. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of particle physics, and is recognized as such by the scientific community. The new economic industry must be directly attributable to this breakthrough, with clear evidence of its establishment, such as the creation of new companies, significant investment, or the generation of substantial revenue. The breakthrough and the resulting industry must be documented and verified by credible sources, including but not limited to scientific journals, major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), and official statements from relevant scientific bodies. In the event of multiple related breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one leads directly to the creation of a new industry.

title: Will a new infectious disease outbreak before 2025 lead to a global economic downturn?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a new infectious disease outbreak is identified and leads to a global economic downturn. A "new infectious disease outbreak" refers to the emergence of a disease not previously identified in humans, causing widespread illness. A "global economic downturn" is defined as a decline in global GDP by at least 0.5% over a calendar year, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. The outbreak must be confirmed by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of these two organizations. The economic impact must be directly attributed to the outbreak by the IMF, the World Bank, or a consensus of economic analysts in reputable financial news sources (e.g., Financial Times, Bloomberg, Reuters).

title: Will Switzerland become a global leader in blockchain technology development by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Switzerland is recognized as a global leader in the development of blockchain technology. Recognition can come from:
- Being home to the highest number of successful blockchain startups, as reported by a reputable global market research firm.
- Leading in blockchain-related patents filed and granted, according to the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO).
- Hosting the most significant global blockchain technology conferences, as recognized by the international tech community.
- Receiving the highest level of investment in blockchain technology projects, as reported by major financial news outlets.

Recognition must be corroborated by reports from at least three reputable sources, including but not limited to the Financial Times, Bloomberg, or Forbes. In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these sources will be used to determine the outcome.

The development of blockchain technology refers to the innovation, research, and successful implementation of blockchain systems and solutions.

title: Will a new technology emerge by 2025 that significantly improves the performance analysis in cricket?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new technology has been introduced that significantly improves the performance analysis in cricket. Significant improvement is defined as a technology that enhances the accuracy, speed, or depth of analysis compared to the state of the art as of 2023. This includes, but is not limited to, advancements in player tracking, ball tracking, biomechanical analysis, or predictive analytics. The technology must be adopted by at least one major cricketing body (e.g., International Cricket Council, Board of Control for Cricket in India, England and Wales Cricket Board) or used in an international cricket tournament. Confirmation of the technology's deployment and its impact must be reported by reputable sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN Cricinfo, BBC Sport, Sky Sports) or through an official announcement by a major cricketing body. In the event of ambiguous advancements, the resolution will be based on a consensus of expert opinion in the field of sports technology.

title: Will Germany launch a state-backed digital currency by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Germany has officially launched a state-backed digital currency. The currency must be recognized as legal tender within Germany and must be backed by the German government or the Bundesbank. The launch of such a currency must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The digital currency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or for specific uses), the question will resolve as Yes if the currency is intended for nationwide use. Temporary or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major golf tournament be influenced by geopolitical tensions before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major golf tournament (defined as one of the four major championships: The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or the PGA Championship) is either canceled, postponed, relocated, or significantly altered in its participant lineup due to geopolitical tensions.

Geopolitical tensions refer to conflicts, sanctions, diplomatic disputes, or other political factors between nations that directly impact the tournament. The influence of geopolitical tensions must be explicitly cited by the tournament's organizing body or widely reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters, etc.) as the reason for the tournament's disruption.

In the event that multiple tournaments are affected in the same year, each instance will be considered separately for this question's resolution. Temporary adjustments to tournament schedules or locations that do not cite geopolitical tensions as the cause do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Virginia play a pivotal role in a major geopolitical event before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Virginia is identified as playing a pivotal role in a major geopolitical event. A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that significantly alters the relationships between nations or has a substantial impact on global political structures or economies. This includes, but is not limited to, wars, significant diplomatic agreements, major terrorist attacks, or economic crises that have global repercussions.

The event must be recognized as "major" and Virginia's role as "pivotal" by at least three of the following reputable news organizations: BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, or The Washington Post. In the absence of such reports, official government statements from at least two G7 countries can also be considered as verification.

In the case of multiple qualifying events, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first event's occurrence. If no such event is recognized by the specified sources by the deadline, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Senate pass a significant bill related to international relations before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Senate has passed a bill that significantly impacts international relations. A "significant bill" is defined as one that involves substantial changes or commitments in terms of diplomacy, trade, defense, or international aid, and is recognized as such by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). The bill must be passed by the Senate and not merely proposed or passed by other branches of the US government. In the event of ambiguity regarding the bill's significance, the consensus among these news organizations will serve as the deciding factor. The resolution will rely on official government announcements or credible news reports for verification.

title: Will SpaceX's development of reusable launch systems significantly influence global space policy by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, SpaceX's development of reusable launch systems has led to significant changes in global space policy. Significant influence on global space policy is defined as:
- The adoption of new policies or amendments to existing policies by major spacefaring nations (e.g., USA, Russia, China, European Union member states) or international space organizations (e.g., United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs, International Astronautical Federation) that explicitly encourage or mandate the use of reusable launch systems.
- The establishment of international agreements or treaties among spacefaring nations that prioritize or significantly incentivize the development and use of reusable launch systems over single-use systems.

The influence must be directly attributable to SpaceX's development efforts, as evidenced by official government or organizational documents, or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a major discovery in epidemiology lead to a significant shift in global health policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major discovery in the field of epidemiology leads to a significant shift in global health policy. A "major discovery" is defined as a finding that substantially alters the understanding of disease transmission, prevention, or treatment, and is recognized as such by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of public health. A "significant shift" in global health policy refers to the adoption of new guidelines, practices, or strategies by at least three G20 countries, as a direct result of the discovery, that markedly change the approach to disease prevention, management, or containment. The shift must be documented by official government announcements, policy documents, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Discoveries that only lead to minor adjustments or are limited to national or regional significance do not meet this criterion. The resolution will consider only those changes that are implemented and publicly acknowledged by the respective governments or organizations by the resolution date.

title: Will the outcome of the 2020 US presidential election lead to major electoral reform in the United States by 2025?
Will a significant geopolitical event be influenced by advancements in string theory research by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a significant geopolitical event (e.g., formation of new international treaties, major shifts in global alliances, significant changes in national defense strategies) is directly influenced by advancements in string theory research. The influence of string theory must be explicitly acknowledged by at least one of the parties involved in the event or by reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The event must be of a scale that impacts the policies or strategic direction of at least one nation-state. In the absence of explicit acknowledgment, consensus among experts in the field of international relations or physics, as reported by reputable news sources or academic publications, may also be considered sufficient evidence. The resolution will consider only those advancements in string theory that have been published in peer-reviewed scientific journals or officially recognized by the scientific community. In the event of ambiguous situations, a panel of experts in international relations and physics, as reported by reputable sources, will be consulted to determine the influence of string theory on the geopolitical event.

title: Will the NHL host an international tournament in a country currently facing significant geopolitical tensions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially hosted an international tournament in a country that, at the time of the announcement, is facing significant geopolitical tensions. Significant geopolitical tensions are defined as those involving military conflict, economic sanctions imposed by at least half of the G7 nations, or widespread international condemnation for human rights violations. The tournament must be an official NHL event, recognized by the league and involving teams or players representing at least three different countries. Confirmation must come from an official NHL announcement or coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters). In the event of a tournament announcement followed by a resolution of the geopolitical tensions before the event takes place, the question will still resolve as Yes if the tournament proceeds as planned.

title: Will Google's global operations be significantly affected by a new international cyber law by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new international cyber law is enacted that significantly affects Google's global operations. Significant effect includes, but is not limited to, changes in data handling practices, modifications to content management policies, adjustments in advertising operations, or any legal actions that result in a financial impact of at least 1% of Google's annual global revenue. The enactment of the law must be confirmed by official government documentation or announcements from at least three countries where Google operates. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient to confirm the law's impact. Temporary measures or laws affecting only specific regions within countries do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the integration of AI into financial systems cause the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into financial systems has caused the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly. Significant fluctuation is defined as a change of more than 10% in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian Dollar, Swiss Franc, and Australian Dollar) within a single calendar year, as reported by the Federal Reserve. The fluctuation must be directly attributed to the integration of AI into financial systems, as confirmed by statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

title: Will AI-driven legislative analysis tools be widely used by the US Congress to inform decision-making by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, AI-driven legislative analysis tools are widely used by members of the US Congress to inform their decision-making processes. "Widely used" is defined as being utilized by at least 50% of voting members in either the House of Representatives or the Senate for the analysis of legislative texts, prediction of legislative outcomes, or guidance on policy impacts. The use of such tools must be confirmed by official statements from Congress, documented in credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post), or through peer-reviewed research publications. In the absence of clear public statements, evidence from multiple reputable sources indicating widespread adoption among Congress members will be considered sufficient. AI-driven tools must perform tasks beyond simple data aggregation, including but not limited to predictive analytics, natural language processing for understanding and summarizing texts, and simulation models to forecast policy outcomes. Tools used in a trial phase or for a limited period do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Nations establish a global AI ethics framework by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Nations (UN) has officially established a global framework for artificial intelligence (AI) ethics. The framework must be designed to guide the development, deployment, and governance of AI technologies on a global scale. It must be adopted by the UN through an official act, such as a resolution passed by the General Assembly or an agreement among member states. The establishment of the framework must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must include specific guidelines or principles addressing ethical considerations related to AI, such as transparency, accountability, privacy, and fairness. In the event of a partial or preliminary framework, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear commitment and timeline for the adoption of a comprehensive global framework.

title: Will a new AI-driven epidemiology tool predict the next global pandemic with over 90% accuracy before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a new AI-driven epidemiology tool is developed and successfully predicts the next global pandemic with over 90% accuracy. The prediction must be specific to the pathogen type (e.g., virus, bacteria), its origin, and the timeframe of outbreak. The tool's prediction accuracy must be verified by a consensus of at least three leading health organizations (e.g., WHO, CDC, ECDC) or by publication in at least three peer-reviewed scientific journals. The tool must be publicly acknowledged by these organizations or publications as having met the 90% accuracy threshold in its prediction. In the event of multiple tools meeting these criteria, the resolution will be based on the first tool to be publicly acknowledged as meeting the accuracy threshold. Predictions made retrospectively, after the pandemic has begun, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Amazon deploy an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially deployed a system that utilizes artificial intelligence for the full autonomous management of at least one of its warehouse operations. The system must be capable of performing all tasks required for warehouse management without human intervention. These tasks include but are not limited to inventory management, order processing, picking and packing, and shipping logistics. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific warehouses), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for expansion to additional warehouses. Temporary deployments or the use of similar technology for specific tasks within the warehouse do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will North Korea significantly reform its legal system by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, North Korea has implemented significant reforms in its legal system. Significant reforms are defined as changes that lead to increased transparency, the establishment of independent judiciary bodies, the introduction of laws that significantly enhance human rights protections, or the reduction of the government's direct control over legal proceedings. The reforms must be recognized and reported by at least three reputable international news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters) or international human rights organizations (Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch). In the absence of direct reports, official government announcements or documentation will be considered. The question will resolve as No if such reforms are not implemented or if they are reversed before the resolution date. In the case of ambiguous reforms, a consensus among the aforementioned sources will be required to determine the significance of the reforms.

title: Will Japan introduce a new constitution amendment related to digital privacy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Japan has officially introduced a new amendment to its constitution that specifically addresses digital privacy. The amendment must explicitly mention digital privacy as its focus and aim to enhance the protection of citizens' digital data from unauthorized access, use, or surveillance. The introduction of such an amendment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The amendment must be passed and incorporated into the Japanese Constitution, not merely proposed or under consideration. In the event of ambiguity regarding the amendment's focus on digital privacy, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an international legal agreement on sports ethics and fairness be established by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an international legal agreement on sports ethics and fairness is officially established and recognized by at least 50% of the member countries of the United Nations. The agreement must address at least the following core issues: doping, corruption, gender equality, and athletes' rights. It must be ratified or officially accepted by the participating countries and be enforceable by an international governing body or court. The establishment of such an agreement must be confirmed by an official announcement from the United Nations or the international governing body responsible for the agreement. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The agreement must be comprehensive, covering multiple sports disciplines and applicable worldwide. In the event of a partial agreement (e.g., limited to specific sports or regions), the question will resolve as No unless it is explicitly intended for global application and expansion.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a health and wellness rewards program regulated by the Food and Drug Administration by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a health and wellness rewards program that is regulated by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

A "major cryptocurrency platform" is defined as a platform with at least 1 million active users worldwide. The health and wellness rewards program must offer incentives, such as discounts or cryptocurrency rewards, for activities or purchases that promote health and wellness, as defined by the FDA.

The introduction of the program must be confirmed by an official announcement from the cryptocurrency platform and documentation of FDA regulation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be sufficient for resolution.

The program must be operational and available to users, not in a trial phase. Programs that are limited to specific regions within the U.S. will count towards this question's resolution, provided they are intended for national expansion.

title: Will Israel become the first country to officially adopt a cryptocurrency as legal tender by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Israel has officially adopted a cryptocurrency as legal tender, recognized for all forms of financial transactions within its jurisdiction. The adoption must be confirmed through an official government announcement or legal documentation. In the absence of a direct government announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be usable for both public and private transactions, including taxes, goods, and services purchases. This question will resolve as No if no cryptocurrency has been adopted as legal tender by the specified date or if the adoption is only for limited use cases (e.g., specific types of transactions or in certain regions within the country).

title: Will Mexico launch a national cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Mexico has officially launched a national cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and endorsed by the Mexican government as a legal tender within the country. The launch of such a cryptocurrency must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or for certain transactions), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for nationwide use. Private cryptocurrencies or digital assets launched by entities within Mexico without official government endorsement do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major tennis event be cancelled or relocated due to geopolitical tensions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any of the four Grand Slam tennis events (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, US Open) is either cancelled or relocated due to geopolitical tensions. Geopolitical tensions refer to conflicts between nations that significantly impact international relations, such as war, sanctions, or diplomatic disputes. The cancellation or relocation must be officially announced by the event's organizing body or recognized by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters). Temporary venue changes within the host country do not count as relocation. In the event of a dispute over the cause of cancellation or relocation, the decision of the event's organizing body will be final.

title: Will Canada impose new sanctions on a foreign country due to geopolitical conflicts by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Canada has officially imposed new sanctions on any foreign country as a direct response to geopolitical conflicts. The imposition of sanctions must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The sanctions must be new, distinct from any previous sanctions, and specifically linked to geopolitical conflicts occurring after the date of this question's posting. This question resolves as YES upon the official announcement of the sanctions by the Canadian government or credible confirmation by major news outlets. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will North Korea engage in a significant diplomatic negotiation with a Western country by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, North Korea has engaged in significant diplomatic negotiations with at least one Western country. Significant diplomatic negotiations are defined as official talks directly involving North Korean and Western country representatives, aimed at addressing major policy issues, security concerns, or normalization of relations. The negotiations must be officially acknowledged by both participating parties or confirmed through a joint statement. In the absence of official acknowledgment, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient for resolution. The term "Western country" refers to any country in North America, Western Europe, or Australasia. Preliminary talks, unofficial dialogues, or negotiations solely through intermediaries do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics introduce a new category for AI and robotics-related jobs by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) has officially introduced a new category specifically for AI and robotics-related jobs within its employment classifications. The introduction of such a category must be documented in an official BLS publication or press release. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The new category must distinctly cover jobs primarily focused on the development, maintenance, or operation of AI and robotics technologies, excluding broader categories that may incidentally include these roles.

title: Will Scott Alexander publish a paper on the impact of machine learning on future job markets by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Scott Alexander has published a paper specifically addressing the impact of machine learning on future job markets. The paper must be publicly accessible and can be published in any format (e.g., blog post, academic journal, magazine article). It must be a new work, distinct from his previous writings, and must explicitly address the topic of machine learning's impact on job markets in the future. Verification will be based on the publication's presence on Scott Alexander's official blog or a recognized academic or professional publication. In the absence of direct publication, credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian) confirming the publication will also be considered sufficient. The resolution will be based on the date of publication as officially stated or reported.

title: Will a major breakthrough in quantum computing be announced by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in quantum computing is announced. A "major breakthrough" is defined as any development that significantly advances the field of quantum computing in terms of computational power, error rates, scalability, or practical applications. The breakthrough must be recognized as such by the scientific community, with confirmation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference. In the absence of direct scientific publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Developments that only represent incremental improvements or are speculative in nature without empirical validation do not qualify.

title: Will Tesla's advancements in battery technology significantly reduce carbon emissions worldwide by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Tesla's advancements in battery technology have led to a significant reduction in global carbon emissions. A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease of at least 10% in global carbon emissions from 2020 levels, attributable directly to the adoption of Tesla's battery technology in electric vehicles, energy storage systems, or other applications. The assessment of Tesla's impact on carbon emissions will be based on data and analysis from authoritative sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), or equivalent. Reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the reduction and Tesla's contribution to it will also be considered sufficient for resolution. In the absence of clear data linking Tesla's battery technology to a global emissions reduction, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Spain achieve its goal of 100% renewable energy for electricity production by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Spain has officially achieved its goal of utilizing 100% renewable energy sources for its electricity production. The energy sources considered renewable include solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass. The achievement must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The resolution will consider the net electricity production over the calendar year 2030, accounting for any imports or exports of electricity. In the event of a temporary shortfall in renewable energy production, the question will resolve as No unless the shortfall is rectified and the 100% renewable goal is met by the end of 2030.

title: Will a significant environmental policy be implemented in the NHL to reduce its carbon footprint by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially implemented a significant environmental policy aimed at reducing its carbon footprint. A policy will be considered significant if it results in a measurable reduction in greenhouse gas emissions across the league's operations, including but not limited to team travel, energy use in arenas, and waste management. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official NHL announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. The policy must be fully operational, not in a trial phase. Temporary measures or policies that are not league-wide do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a new global climate agreement before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the United Nations officially adopts a new global climate agreement aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, promoting sustainable development, or enhancing international cooperation on climate change. The agreement must be adopted by a majority of UN member states during a UN Climate Change Conference or a similar high-level meeting. The adoption of the agreement must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The agreement must represent a new initiative or a significant amendment to existing agreements (e.g., the Paris Agreement) and must be intended for global implementation. Temporary measures or agreements limited to specific regions or groups of countries do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will SpaceX establish a permanent human settlement on Mars before 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, SpaceX has established a permanent human settlement on Mars. A "permanent human settlement" is defined as a self-sustaining habitat capable of supporting human life indefinitely without requiring constant resupply from Earth. The settlement must include living quarters, life support systems, and facilities for at least 10 people. The establishment of the settlement must be confirmed by SpaceX through an official announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The settlement must be operational, not in a trial phase. Temporary habitats or research stations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a member of the United Nations introduce a resolution to regulate artificial intelligence globally by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any member country of the United Nations has officially introduced a resolution aimed at regulating artificial intelligence (AI) on a global scale. The resolution must seek to establish guidelines, standards, or laws applicable to the development, deployment, or use of AI technologies across multiple countries. The introduction of such a resolution must be confirmed by an official UN document or announcement. In the absence of direct UN confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The resolution must be formally presented in a UN session or committee for discussion or voting. Preliminary discussions, proposals, or mentions that do not lead to a formal introduction do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will France host another major international sports event by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France is officially announced as the host country for a major international sports event. A "major international sports event" is defined as an event with significant international participation and viewership, such as the Olympic Games, FIFA World Cup, Rugby World Cup, or similar scale events. The announcement must come from the event's governing body or an official government source. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The event must be scheduled to take place by December 31, 2035, to account for planning and preparation timeframes. In the event of a cancellation or postponement beyond 2035, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major sports league scandal influence a US Senate election outcome before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a scandal involving any major sports league (e.g., NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL) is directly linked to influencing the outcome of a US Senate election. The scandal must involve either a significant figure within the sports league (e.g., player, coach, owner) or the league itself and must be shown to have a measurable impact on the election results. The link between the scandal and the election outcome must be confirmed by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Guardian). The impact on the election must be significant, such as causing a major shift in voter preference or directly affecting the election's result. In the absence of direct evidence linking the scandal to the election outcome, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a focus on the intent and impact of the scandal.

title: Will Switzerland produce a world champion in a major sports league by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an athlete or team from Switzerland wins a championship title in one of the following major sports leagues:

- FIFA World Cup (men or women)
- UEFA Champions League (men or women)
- National Basketball Association (NBA)
- National Hockey League (NHL)
- Major League Baseball (MLB)
- Formula One World Championship

The athlete or team must be recognized as representing Switzerland, either by nationality (for individual athletes) or by official team location (for teams). In the case of individual athletes in team sports, they must be a significant contributor to their team's championship win, as evidenced by playing time, scoring, or awards.

In the event of a new major sports league rising to international prominence by 2030 that is not listed above, it will be considered if it is recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or a similar authoritative body in sports.

This question resolves as NO if no such championship is won by the specified date.

title: Will a major basketball event lead to a significant increase in cryptocurrency transactions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major basketball event (e.g., NBA Finals, FIBA World Cup) is directly linked to a significant increase in cryptocurrency transactions. A 'significant increase' is defined as a 10% rise in daily transactions globally, compared to the average daily transaction volume 30 days prior to the event. The increase must be sustained for at least 7 consecutive days within a 30-day period following the event. The link between the basketball event and the increase in transactions must be confirmed by data from a reputable financial tracking service (e.g., CoinMarketCap, Blockchain.com) and reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, CNBC, Reuters). Temporary spikes in transactions not directly attributable to the basketball event, such as those caused by market volatility or unrelated global events, will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any European Union regulation significantly impact the cryptocurrency market by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the European Union has enacted one or more regulations that significantly impact the cryptocurrency market. A regulation will be considered to have a significant impact if it meets any of the following criteria:
- It leads to a change of 10% or more in the total market capitalization of cryptocurrencies within a 30-day period following its announcement or implementation.
- It introduces new, mandatory compliance requirements for a majority of cryptocurrency exchanges operating within the EU, affecting their operations.
- It results in the banning or severe restriction of one or more major cryptocurrencies (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum) within the EU.
Significant impact will be determined based on reports from reputable financial news sources (e.g., Financial Times, Bloomberg, Reuters) and data from recognized cryptocurrency market analysis firms.
In the event of multiple regulations, the question will resolve as Yes if any single regulation meets the criteria for significant impact. Regulations that are proposed but not enacted by the resolution date do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a breakthrough in blockchain engineering significantly reduce transaction fees across major cryptocurrencies by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a breakthrough in blockchain engineering has been publicly announced and demonstrated to significantly reduce transaction fees across major cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum, and at least two others among the top 10 by market capitalization at the time of the breakthrough).

A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease of at least 50% in the average transaction fee from the yearly average of the year prior to the announcement, for each cryptocurrency affected.
The breakthrough must be verifiable through a peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific or technical journal, or an official announcement from a leading blockchain development team.

In the absence of such publications or announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary reductions due to market fluctuations or adjustments in network difficulty do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will India launch its own digital currency to compete with major cryptocurrencies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Government of India has officially launched a digital currency designed to compete with major cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc. The launch must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The digital currency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. The intent to compete with major cryptocurrencies must be explicitly stated by official government sources or inferred from the functionality and design of the digital currency. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or for specific applications), the question will resolve as Yes if the digital currency is intended for nationwide use and broader financial integration.

title: Will the value of Bitcoin exceed the US dollar in terms of global transaction volume by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the total global transaction volume of Bitcoin exceeds that of the US dollar within a single calendar year. Transaction volume refers to the total value of all transactions processed over a given time period. This includes but is not limited to purchases, sales, and transfers. The assessment will be based on data reported by authoritative financial institutions or organizations specializing in tracking cryptocurrency and fiat currency transactions, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, major central banks, or recognized financial market analysis firms. In the absence of direct data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The resolution will consider adjustments for inflation and currency valuation changes over the period. In the event of a close call, where the transaction volumes are within a margin of error of 5% or less, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a breakthrough in quantum computing significantly increase the security of cryptocurrencies by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in quantum computing has been achieved that significantly increases the security of cryptocurrencies. A "breakthrough" is defined as a development or discovery in quantum computing that enables a substantial improvement in cryptographic security measures against both quantum and classical computing threats. The improvement must be applicable to and implemented in at least one major cryptocurrency (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum). The implementation must be confirmed by the development team of the cryptocurrency or through a peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific or technical journal. In the absence of direct confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The question will resolve as No if such a breakthrough has not been publicly confirmed by the specified date.

title: Will DeepMind develop a breakthrough AI model for predicting pandemics before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed and publicly announced a breakthrough artificial intelligence model specifically designed for predicting pandemics. A "breakthrough" is defined as a significant advancement over existing models in terms of accuracy, speed, or predictive capabilities, as recognized by the scientific community or a leading health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC). The model must demonstrate its effectiveness through peer-reviewed research or a public demonstration of its predictive capabilities. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The model must be operational and available for use by health organizations or the public. In the event of a collaborative development with other entities, the question will resolve as Yes only if DeepMind's contribution is pivotal and acknowledged as such by the collaborating entities or in the official announcement.

title: Will Russia develop a new vaccine for a global pandemic that is over 90% effective by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Russia has developed a new vaccine that is confirmed to be over 90% effective against a global pandemic virus. The vaccine's effectiveness must be verified through Phase 3 clinical trial results published in a peer-reviewed medical journal or officially announced by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Russian Ministry of Health. The pandemic in question must be recognized as such by the WHO at the time of the vaccine's development. In the event of multiple vaccines being developed, only the first to meet these criteria will be considered for resolution. The vaccine must be designed for human use. In the absence of direct confirmation from the WHO or the Russian Ministry of Health, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution.

title: Will Israel lead a global initiative to improve pandemic preparedness by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Israel has initiated and is leading a global initiative aimed at improving pandemic preparedness. The initiative must involve collaboration with at least three other countries and must be focused on at least one of the following areas: vaccine development, rapid response systems, global health surveillance, or the establishment of international health guidelines. The leadership and initiation of the initiative by Israel must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Israeli government or a recognized international health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The initiative must be new, not an extension or part of an existing program. In the event of a collaborative effort where Israel is not clearly the lead, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX's Reusable Launch System significantly reduce the cost of space travel, leading to a new economic boom in space tourism by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, SpaceX's Reusable Launch System has led to a significant reduction in the cost of space travel, resulting in a measurable increase in space tourism activities. A 'significant reduction' is defined as a decrease in the average cost of sending a payload to orbit by at least 50% compared to 2020 levels, as reported by authoritative space industry sources or SpaceX's official publications. A 'new economic boom in space tourism' is defined as at least a 100% increase in the number of space tourists or space tourism ventures compared to 2020, as reported by reputable space tourism companies, industry reports, or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The assessment will consider official data and reports from SpaceX, space tourism companies, and industry analysts. In the absence of clear data, consensus among reputable space industry experts will be used to determine the outcome. The resolution will not consider unverified claims or speculative projections.

title: Will France become the leading European country in terms of GDP by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has the highest Gross Domestic Product (GDP) among European countries, measured in nominal terms (current US dollars) according to the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The GDP figures used for resolution will be the latest available from either organization as of the resolution date. In the event that the World Bank and the IMF provide conflicting data, the source with the most recent publication date will be used for resolution. This question will resolve as No if France does not meet these criteria by the specified date. In case of significant economic events affecting the accuracy of GDP measurements (e.g., a major country leaving or joining the European Union), the question may be extended to allow for updated figures to be considered.

title: Will the global market value of basketball exceed $100 billion by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global market value of basketball, including but not limited to leagues, teams, merchandise, broadcasting rights, sponsorships, and related business activities, exceeds $100 billion USD. The valuation must be confirmed by financial reports from reputable market research firms such as Forbes, Statista, or similar entities. In the absence of a single comprehensive report, cumulative evidence from multiple credible sources that collectively support the valuation exceeding $100 billion USD will be considered. The market value assessment must include global revenues and be based on publicly available financial data. In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus among the majority of reputable sources will determine the resolution. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of the market valuation exceeding the specified amount, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

title: Will Italy face a major geopolitical crisis before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Italy faces a geopolitical crisis that meets any of the following criteria:
- Official declaration of a state of emergency by the Italian government due to geopolitical reasons.
- Imposition of significant international sanctions against Italy by the United Nations, European Union, or a coalition of G7 countries.
- Military engagement on Italian soil or in its territorial waters that involves the Italian military and foreign forces, recognized as an act of war or an armed conflict by the United Nations.
- A significant diplomatic breakdown that leads to the expulsion of diplomats or closure of embassies between Italy and at least three other G7 countries.

The crisis must be reported and confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

In the event of multiple qualifying incidents, the question will resolve as Yes upon the occurrence of the first incident meeting the above criteria.

title: Will a significant geopolitical event be influenced by advancements in theoretical physics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant geopolitical event is directly influenced by advancements in theoretical physics. A "significant geopolitical event" is defined as an event that has a substantial impact on international relations, such as a treaty, an alliance formation, a declaration of war, or a major policy shift recognized by the United Nations or a similar authoritative body. An "advancement in theoretical physics" refers to a breakthrough or significant development in the field that is recognized by the scientific community, published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The influence of theoretical physics on the geopolitical event must be explicitly acknowledged by official statements from the governments or organizations involved, or through analysis in reputable scientific or international affairs publications. In the absence of explicit acknowledgment, a consensus among experts in the field, as reported by reputable news sources, will suffice. The question will resolve as No if these criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will Formula 1 significantly influence international relations or diplomacy by 2030?
Will Virginia lead the US in nuclear energy production by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the state of Virginia has the highest nuclear energy production capacity in the United States, measured in megawatts (MW). Nuclear energy production capacity is defined as the maximum output of electricity a nuclear power plant can produce under specific conditions. The resolution will be based on the official data published by the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) or another authoritative source designated by the U.S. Department of Energy. In the event that the EIA does not publish data for 2030 by the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the most recent data available. If Virginia leads in nuclear energy production at any point in 2030 according to the latest data, the question will resolve as Yes. In case of a tie in production capacity between Virginia and another state, the question will resolve as Yes.

title: Will a member of the US Senate introduce a bill that significantly alters nuclear energy policy before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a member of the US Senate introduces a bill that significantly alters the United States' nuclear energy policy. Significant alteration includes, but is not limited to, changes in funding, safety regulations, waste management, or the construction of new nuclear power plants. The bill must be officially introduced in the Senate and recognized as pertaining to nuclear energy policy by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) or official government publications. In the event of multiple bills, the question will resolve as Yes upon the introduction of the first bill meeting these criteria. For clarity, 'introduces a bill' refers to the formal presentation of the bill to the Senate for consideration. This question resolves as NO if no such bill is introduced by the specified date.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health influence a significant change in election health safety protocols before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) has influenced a significant change in election health safety protocols in Virginia. A "significant change" is defined as a new or revised set of guidelines or regulations that materially alter the way elections are conducted in terms of health safety, with the aim of preventing disease transmission during the voting process. This could include, but is not limited to, changes in voting booth sanitation, the implementation of social distancing measures, adjustments to voting times or locations to reduce crowding, or the introduction of mail-in voting or electronic voting options as standard practice. The change must be officially announced by the VDH or a related government body and must be implemented statewide. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of the VDH's influence on the change. Temporary measures introduced for a single election do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will machine learning be used to predict election outcomes in any country with over 90% accuracy before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a machine learning model is used to predict the outcome of a national election in any country with a population exceeding 1 million people, and achieves an accuracy rate of over 90% compared to the official election results. The prediction must be made public before the election occurs and must cover the majority of elected positions or the overall election result. The accuracy of the prediction must be verified by a reputable source, such as a major news organization (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or an academic publication. In the event that multiple machine learning models meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one model achieves the specified accuracy. Machine learning models used for internal purposes by political parties or governments without public disclosure do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland introduce a new electronic voting system to enhance election security by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Switzerland has officially introduced a new electronic voting system aimed at enhancing election security. The system must be fully operational and used in at least one federal or cantonal election to qualify. The introduction of the system must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must demonstrate enhanced security features compared to previous systems, such as advanced encryption, multi-factor authentication, or blockchain technology. In the event of a pilot program or limited deployment, the question will resolve as Yes if there is a clear, documented plan for nationwide implementation.

title: Will the outcome of the 2024 US Elections significantly impact US immigration policy?
Will a major social sciences study reveal the impact of engineering advancements on societal structures by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major study in the social sciences is published that reveals significant findings on the impact of engineering advancements (such as artificial intelligence, robotics, green energy technologies, or infrastructure development) on societal structures. The study must be conducted by a reputable academic institution or research organization and must be published in a peer-reviewed journal recognized in the field of social sciences. The findings should address changes in at least one of the following areas: employment, social inequality, urban development, or family dynamics. The study must be cited by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or recognized by a leading academic body in the social sciences as a significant contribution to the field. In the event that multiple studies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the publication of the first study that meets all the specified conditions.

title: Will a Supreme Court of the US decision before 2025 lead to a major shift in social sciences research priorities?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a decision by the Supreme Court of the United States directly results in a significant shift in the priorities of social sciences research in the United States. A "significant shift" is defined as a change in funding allocation by major research institutions or government bodies (e.g., National Science Foundation, National Institutes of Health) of at least 20% towards new or different areas of research within the social sciences, compared to the previous year. The shift must be attributable directly to the Supreme Court decision, as reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) or official government announcements. The decision and its impact on research priorities must be clearly documented and recognized by the academic community in the social sciences.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark ruling on digital privacy rights by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States has issued a ruling that significantly alters the legal landscape of digital privacy rights in the United States. A "landmark ruling" is defined as a decision that establishes a new legal precedent, significantly changes existing laws or legal interpretations, or has a broad impact on digital privacy rights nationwide. The ruling must be related to the protection, violation, or interpretation of digital privacy rights in contexts such as online communication, data protection, surveillance, or digital data collection by private or government entities. The resolution will be based on official Supreme Court documents. In the absence of clear documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. This question resolves as YES upon the issuance of such a ruling, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

title: Will a significant legal dispute between the US and China lead to a new international treaty by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant legal dispute between the United States and China results in the signing of a new international treaty. A "significant legal dispute" is defined as a conflict that involves substantial legal disagreements between the two nations, leading to formal legal proceedings or an official dispute resolution process. The treaty must be aimed at resolving the dispute in question or preventing similar disputes in the future. The signing of the treaty must be officially announced by both the United States and China, or confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event that multiple treaties are signed as a result of different disputes, the question will resolve as Yes upon the signing of the first treaty that meets these criteria. The treaty must be ratified by both countries to count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major legal case involving sports betting in tennis be adjudicated by the Supreme Court before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States adjudicates a major legal case involving sports betting in tennis. A "major legal case" is defined as a case that directly impacts the legality, regulation, or significant operational practices of sports betting in tennis across multiple states. The case must be explicitly related to sports betting in tennis, not general gambling or sports betting. The resolution will be based on official court documents or announcements from the Supreme Court. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. In the event that multiple cases are adjudicated, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first case's adjudication.
