title: Will Iran launch a manned mission to space by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Iran has successfully launched a manned mission to space. The mission must involve at least one Iranian astronaut leaving Earth's atmosphere and entering space, defined as crossing the Kármán line (100 kilometers above Earth's surface). The mission can be conducted independently by Iran or in collaboration with other countries or private entities. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the Iranian Space Agency or a reputable international space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or suborbital flights that cross the Kármán line but do not enter orbit do count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a dispute over the mission's success or the involvement of Iranian astronauts, the question will resolve based on the consensus of reports from the aforementioned news organizations.

title: Will the United Nations establish a new space-related treaty or agreement by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations has officially established a new treaty or agreement specifically related to space exploration, use, or governance. The treaty or agreement must be formally adopted by the United Nations General Assembly or an equivalent body and must address issues such as space territory, resource utilization, space debris management, or the militarization of space. Confirmation must come from an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The treaty or agreement must be new, not an amendment or extension of existing treaties. In the event of a dispute over the novelty of the treaty or agreement, the question will resolve based on the consensus of legal experts in international space law.

title: Will South Korea land a rover on the moon by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, South Korea has successfully landed a rover on the moon. The rover must be operational upon landing and capable of conducting its intended scientific or exploratory missions. The landing must be confirmed by the Korea Aerospace Research Institute (KARI) or an equivalent South Korean governmental body. In the absence of an official announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable international news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Reuters) or a publication in a recognized scientific journal will be sufficient. The mission must be a South Korean initiative, although international collaboration is permissible. Temporary or failed landings, such as crashes without data transmission, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Google announce a significant breakthrough in natural sciences research by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google (or any of its subsidiaries) officially announces a significant breakthrough in the field of natural sciences. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that represents a major advancement in understanding or application in any of the natural sciences (including, but not limited to, biology, chemistry, physics, earth science, and astronomy). The announcement must be made through an official Google press release or a publication in a reputable scientific journal. The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, as evidenced by coverage in at least three major science news outlets (e.g., Scientific American, Nature News, Science Daily) or citations in peer-reviewed scientific journals. In the absence of widespread recognition, the question will resolve as No. The breakthrough must be new, not a continuation or incremental improvement of existing technologies or research.

title: Will the World Health Organization announce a significant natural sciences discovery related to global health by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially announces a significant natural sciences discovery that has a direct and substantial impact on global health. A "significant discovery" is defined as a finding that leads to a notable advancement in the understanding, prevention, treatment, or eradication of a disease or health condition affecting a large portion of the global population. The announcement must be made through an official WHO press release or publication. In the absence of a direct announcement, confirmation by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Discoveries that are primarily technological or pharmaceutical in nature, without a clear and direct link to natural sciences, do not qualify. In the event of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community, as reflected in publications in peer-reviewed journals or statements by recognized health authorities, will be the deciding factor.

title: Will Amazon sponsor a major global sports event by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Amazon has officially sponsored a major global sports event. A "major global sports event" is defined as any international sports competition that attracts significant global viewership and media coverage, such as the Olympic Games, FIFA World Cup, ICC Cricket World Cup, or similar. The sponsorship must be confirmed through an official announcement by Amazon or the organizing body of the event. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The sponsorship must be for the main event, not for individual teams or athletes. In the event of a dispute over what constitutes a "major global sports event," the resolution will default to the consensus of major sports news outlets.

title: Will a sports team based in Virginia win a national championship in any major league by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any sports team based in Virginia wins a national championship in one of the following major leagues: NFL (National Football League), NBA (National Basketball Association), MLB (Major League Baseball), NHL (National Hockey League), or MLS (Major League Soccer).

A "national championship" refers to the final championship victory that concludes the league's official season. For collegiate sports, this includes NCAA Division I championships in football (FBS or FCS), basketball (men's or women's), baseball, and soccer (men's or women's).

The team must be officially recognized as based in Virginia by the league or governing body. In the event of a dispute over the team's location, the team's primary operational base or official address in the league's records will be used to determine eligibility.

This question does not include championships in minor leagues, international competitions, or exhibition games. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the respective league or governing body.

title: Will Germany host the Olympic Games by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, Germany is officially announced as the host country for any upcoming Olympic Games (Summer or Winter). The announcement must come from the International Olympic Committee (IOC) and be confirmed through official IOC channels or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The decision must be for the Olympic Games to be held in 2041 or later, but the announcement must occur by the specified resolution date. In the event that multiple countries are announced as co-hosts, the question will resolve as Yes if Germany is one of the co-hosts. Temporary or speculative announcements that are not finalized by the IOC by the resolution date will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant discovery in physics lead to a new economic model or job sector as predicted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in physics leads to the creation of a new economic model or job sector, as predicted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). A "significant discovery in physics" refers to a breakthrough or advancement that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of physical laws, as recognized by the scientific community. The new economic model or job sector must be explicitly linked to this discovery and must be acknowledged by the BLS in its publications or official announcements. The discovery and its economic impact must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of direct BLS acknowledgment, credible reports from these news sources that detail the economic impact of the discovery will suffice for resolution. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of the new economic model or job sector by the BLS or through credible news reports. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will a breakthrough in physics lead to a significant advancement in solving complex natural science problems by 2030?
body: A "breakthrough in physics" refers to a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of physical laws, leading to new theoretical or practical applications in solving complex natural science problems. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a widely recognized breakthrough in physics that results in a significant advancement in solving complex natural science problems. The advancement must be demonstrable through either the publication of research in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, the development of new technology, or the achievement of a previously unattainable scientific milestone. The breakthrough and its implications must be acknowledged by a consensus within the scientific community or by a leading scientific organization (e.g., the National Academy of Sciences, the Royal Society). In the absence of a consensus, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "significant advancement" is defined as a development that enables progress in understanding or solving problems that were previously considered intractable or significantly enhances the efficiency or accuracy of existing solutions.

title: Will a major discovery in the natural sciences significantly influence the development of sports science, particularly in tennis, by 2030?
Will Donald Trump announce a run for presidency in the next election cycle?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump officially announces his candidacy for the presidency in the next election cycle. The announcement must be made by Donald Trump himself, either in a public speech, through official social media channels, or via an official campaign press release. The announcement must explicitly state his intention to run for the presidency in the next election cycle. Confirmation from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be required to verify the announcement. In the absence of a direct announcement from Donald Trump, credible reports from at least three major news organizations confirming his intention to run will also result in a Yes resolution. This question will resolve as No if no such announcement is made by the specified date.

title: Will a major shift in energy policy influence the outcome of the next US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the day following the US presidential election in 2024, a major shift in energy policy is widely credited by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) with having a significant influence on the election outcome. A "major shift in energy policy" refers to a substantial change in national energy policy, including but not limited to the adoption of new renewable energy targets, significant alterations in fossil fuel regulations, or major federal investments in energy infrastructure. The influence on the election outcome must be explicitly mentioned as a contributing factor to the election results by the cited news organizations. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear consensus among reputable sources, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a significant political philosophy movement emerge that influences a major election outcome before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a significant political philosophy movement emerges that directly influences the outcome of a major election in any country recognized by the United Nations. A "significant political philosophy movement" is defined as a movement with a coherent set of ideological principles that significantly diverges from the existing mainstream political ideologies and has a substantial following. The influence on a major election outcome must be evidenced by: - The movement's endorsement of a candidate or party that wins an election. - Policy proposals from the movement being adopted by a winning candidate or party. - Significant voter turnout or shift attributed to the movement's influence, as reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, etc.) or recognized political analysis institutions. The emergence of the movement and its influence on the election must be clearly documented and recognized by credible sources. In the event of ambiguity or multiple movements claiming influence, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert analysis and reporting.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the understanding of social physics that influences public policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in the field of social physics is announced and has influenced public policy. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of social physics in a way that directly impacts public policy formulation or implementation. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference. The influence on public policy must be evidenced by the adoption of new policies, significant amendments to existing policies, or the initiation of public policy debates directly attributable to the breakthrough. The adoption or amendment of policies must be confirmed by official government documentation or statements from a recognized authority in the field. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, as evidenced by citations in subsequent research or endorsements by recognized experts in the field.

title: Will Switzerland implement a groundbreaking social policy that becomes a model for other countries by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Switzerland has implemented a social policy that is recognized as groundbreaking and has been adopted or is in the process of being adopted as a model by at least one other country. The policy must address a significant social issue (e.g., healthcare, education, income inequality, environmental sustainability) and demonstrate innovative approaches or solutions that distinguish it from existing policies. The adoption of the policy by another country must be confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be fully implemented and operational within Switzerland. Pilot programs or proposals do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of multiple policies meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one policy fulfills all the specified conditions.

title: Will Joe Biden's presidency have a lasting impact on social science research priorities in the United States by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant shift in social science research priorities in the United States that can be directly attributed to policies, initiatives, or significant actions taken during Joe Biden's presidency. Significant shift means a noticeable change in funding allocation, research topics, or policy influence in the field of social sciences, as compared to the state of affairs before his presidency. This change must be documented by at least three of the following sources: official government publications, statements from major research funding bodies (e.g., National Science Foundation, National Institutes of Health), analyses in peer-reviewed academic journals, or reports from reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of direct attribution to Biden's presidency, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for consensus among the cited sources.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the integration of microbiology and technology to enhance medical diagnostics by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant breakthrough in the integration of microbiology and technology to enhance medical diagnostics is announced. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that leads to the creation of a new diagnostic tool or method that significantly improves the accuracy, speed, or cost-effectiveness of diagnosing diseases compared to the standards of 2023. The breakthrough must be validated through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement from a major health organization (e.g., World Health Organization, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention). In the case of multiple claims, the breakthrough must be recognized and validated by the consensus of the scientific community. Developments that only offer marginal improvements or are in the early stages of research without practical application by the resolution date do not meet the criteria for resolution.

title: Will the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War lead to a major advancement in military technology by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major advancement in military technology directly attributed to the Russo-Ukrainian War is officially announced or recognized. A "major advancement" is defined as a new technology or significant improvement in existing technology that enhances military capabilities in a way that is considered groundbreaking or transformative. This includes, but is not limited to, advancements in weaponry, defense systems, cyber warfare capabilities, or unmanned vehicles. The advancement must be acknowledged by at least one of the following: a defense ministry of a NATO member country, the United Nations, or a reputable defense research institution. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The technology must be deployed or in the process of deployment, not merely in a conceptual or development stage. In the event of multiple advancements, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will Germany become a global leader in renewable energy technology by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Germany is recognized as a global leader in renewable energy technology. Recognition must come from at least one of the following authoritative sources: - The International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) - The International Energy Agency (IEA) - A major global energy conference or summit, specifically mentioning Germany's leadership in renewable energy technology. Leadership in renewable energy technology is defined by: - The development and deployment of innovative renewable energy technologies surpassing current global standards. - Significant contributions to global renewable energy research and development. - A substantial increase in Germany's renewable energy capacity and production, leading the world in either total capacity or growth rate. In the absence of explicit recognition from the above sources, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming Germany's status as a global leader in renewable energy technology will suffice. Temporary achievements or projects that do not indicate a sustained leadership position do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Indian Premier League's (IPL) economic impact exceed $10 billion by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the cumulative economic impact of the Indian Premier League (IPL) is officially reported to exceed $10 billion USD. The economic impact includes direct revenue from the league, such as ticket sales, broadcasting rights, and sponsorships, as well as indirect revenue, such as increased tourism, local business growth, and employment generated by the league's activities. The assessment must be based on a comprehensive study or report by a recognized financial or sports analytics institution. In the absence of a single authoritative report, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reports from at least three reputable financial or sports analytics organizations. The currency exchange rates, if applicable, will be considered based on the rates at the time of the report's publication. In case of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the majority of credible sources.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant economic stimulus package before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes a significant economic stimulus package. A "significant economic stimulus package" is defined as legislation that allocates at least $500 billion towards economic stimulus measures, including but not limited to tax cuts, direct payments to individuals, unemployment benefits, and funding for state and local governments. The passage of the package must be confirmed by an official announcement from the US House of Representatives or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event of multiple packages being passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the criteria specified above. Temporary measures or extensions of existing programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will SpaceX's Starlink project generate over $30 billion in revenue by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX's Starlink project has officially generated over $30 billion in total revenue. Total revenue refers to the cumulative revenue from all Starlink operations and services globally, including but not limited to satellite internet services, government contracts, and any other revenue streams directly attributable to the Starlink project. Revenue figures must be confirmed by SpaceX through official financial statements or reports. In the absence of direct confirmation from SpaceX, credible reports from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, Financial Times) are sufficient. The calculation of total revenue should adhere to generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) or international financial reporting standards (IFRS).

title: Will France implement a nationwide carbon neutrality policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at achieving carbon neutrality. The policy must encompass measures to significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions across all sectors of the economy, including but not limited to energy, transportation, agriculture, and industry, with the goal of balancing emitted and absorbed greenhouse gases. Implementation is defined as the policy being enacted into law by the French government, with clear, actionable steps and timelines for achieving carbon neutrality. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide application.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant increase in green jobs in the US by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) in the United States reports a significant increase in green jobs compared to its last report prior to 2023. A "significant increase" is defined as a rise of at least 20% in the number of green jobs, as categorized and reported by the BLS. The BLS's definition of "green jobs" includes positions in businesses that produce goods or provide services that benefit the environment or conserve natural resources, as well as jobs in which workers' duties involve making their establishment's production processes more environmentally friendly or use fewer natural resources. In the absence of a direct report from the BLS, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the increase based on BLS data or analysis will be sufficient for resolution. This question will resolve as No if the criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will a major engineering breakthrough in renewable energy technology occur by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major engineering breakthrough in renewable energy technology is announced and recognized by the scientific community or a reputable energy sector authority. A "major engineering breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly enhances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or scalability of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, or biomass. The breakthrough must represent a clear advancement beyond the current state of the art and have the potential to substantially impact global renewable energy production or consumption. The announcement of the breakthrough must be confirmed by an official press release from a leading scientific institution, energy company, or government agency. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be demonstrable and verifiable, not merely theoretical or speculative. In the event of multiple claims, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one is widely accepted by the scientific community or a reputable energy sector authority.

title: Will a significant development in atmospheric science influence the value of major cryptocurrencies by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant development in atmospheric science directly influences the market value of one or more major cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, etc.).

A "significant development" refers to a breakthrough or major discovery in atmospheric science that has a demonstrable impact on global climate patterns, weather prediction accuracy, or environmental policy that, in turn, affects the economic landscape.

The influence on cryptocurrency value must be clearly attributable to the development in atmospheric science, as reported by at least three reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal) or major cryptocurrency analysis platforms.

Market value influence must be a direct consequence of the development's implications on the economy, technology adoption, or regulatory changes affecting cryptocurrencies.

In the event of ambiguous impacts, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Brazil introduce a national cryptocurrency regulated by its central bank before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Brazil officially introduces a national cryptocurrency that is regulated by its central bank. The cryptocurrency must be recognized as a legal tender within Brazil and must be designed for general public use, not limited to inter-bank transactions. The introduction of the cryptocurrency must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be fully operational and available to the public, not in a pilot or trial phase. In the event of a limited release (e.g., restricted to certain regions or demographics), the question will resolve as Yes if there is an official plan for nationwide availability.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the European Union has officially implemented a unified regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies across all member states. The framework must be comprehensive, covering aspects such as taxation, anti-money laundering (AML) measures, consumer protection, and the operation of cryptocurrency exchanges. The implementation of such a framework must be confirmed by an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must be legally binding and operational, not merely proposed or in a draft phase. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific aspects of cryptocurrency regulation), the question will resolve as Yes if the framework is intended for full EU-wide application.

title: Will a biotechnology breakthrough lead to a significant increase in global GDP by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a biotechnology breakthrough is directly linked to a significant increase in global GDP. A "significant increase" is defined as a rise in global GDP by at least 5% over a baseline year, adjusted for inflation, attributable to biotechnological advancements. The breakthrough must be widely recognized by the global economic and scientific communities, with confirmation from at least three of the following organizations or publications: The World Bank, International Monetary Fund (IMF), Nature Biotechnology, or Science. The increase in GDP must be reported by reputable global financial news sources, such as Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist. In the event of multiple contributing factors to GDP growth, the biotechnology breakthrough must be identified as the primary driver. This question does not consider incremental improvements in existing biotechnologies but focuses on a novel breakthrough that marks a significant departure from current capabilities.

title: Will the United States enter a recession before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the United States officially enters a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the U.S. Department of Commerce. The determination of a recession by the National Bureau of Economic Research (NBER), which is considered the authoritative body on U.S. recessions, will also result in a Yes resolution. In the absence of an official declaration, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the recession will be sufficient for resolution. This question resolves as NO if these conditions are not met by the specified date.

title: Will NASA's commercial partnerships significantly boost the space economy by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA's commercial partnerships have led to a significant boost in the space economy, as evidenced by:

- A minimum of 50% increase in global space industry revenue compared to 2020, adjusted for inflation. This includes revenues from satellite launches, space tourism, space mining, and other commercial space activities.

- The establishment of at least one commercially viable off-Earth manufacturing facility or habitat, operational and generating revenue.

- The successful launch and operation of at least five significant new commercial space missions (e.g., satellite constellations, space tourism missions, asteroid mining operations) directly resulting from NASA's partnerships.

Significant boost will be determined based on reports from authoritative sources in the space industry, such as the Space Foundation, the International Astronautical Federation, or equivalent. In the absence of direct reports, credible coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Economist) will be considered.

In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific and commercial space community will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will South Korea elect a female president by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea has officially elected a female president. The election must be recognized as legitimate by the National Election Commission of South Korea. In the event of a dispute over the election results, the question will resolve based on the final decision by the Constitutional Court of South Korea. Interim or acting presidents do not count towards this question's resolution unless they are officially elected to the position during their tenure. The resolution will rely on official announcements from the National Election Commission or credible reports from major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a major infectious disease outbreak lead to the implementation of new global health policies by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major infectious disease outbreak has led to the implementation of new global health policies. A "major infectious disease outbreak" is defined as an event where a disease causes significant morbidity or mortality in at least three countries across different WHO regions, and is officially declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) by the World Health Organization (WHO).

New global health policies must be adopted by at least five member countries of the United Nations and aim to address the prevention, preparedness, or response to infectious diseases. These policies must be documented in official government publications or announcements. In the absence of such documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence.

In the event that multiple outbreaks occur, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the criteria above.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) play a pivotal role in a global health crisis response before 2025?

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will Amazon deploy an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially deployed an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management across any of its warehouse facilities. The system must be capable of operating without human intervention for tasks including but not limited to inventory management, order processing, packaging, and shipping. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific warehouses), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide or global expansion. Temporary deployments for specific events or the use of similar technology in private spaces do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI technology play a crucial role in understanding dark matter by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, AI technology has played a crucial role in a significant breakthrough in understanding dark matter. A "crucial role" is defined as AI technology being instrumental in the analysis, interpretation, or discovery process leading to the breakthrough. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement by a major scientific organization (e.g., CERN, NASA, ESA). The use of AI must be explicitly mentioned as a key component in the discovery or analysis process. In the event of multiple contributions to understanding dark matter, this question will resolve as Yes if AI's role is deemed critical by consensus in the scientific community or through acknowledgment in multiple peer-reviewed publications.

title: Will NATO implement AI-driven cybersecurity measures to protect its communications network by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, NATO has officially implemented artificial intelligence-driven cybersecurity measures to protect its communications networks. The implementation must be confirmed by an official NATO announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The measures must be operational, not in a trial phase, and must specifically aim to enhance the security of NATO's communications networks against cyber threats. The resolution will consider the deployment of AI technologies such as machine learning algorithms for threat detection, automated incident response systems, or AI-driven network monitoring and defense mechanisms. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific areas of the network), the question will resolve as Yes if the measures are intended for full network coverage.

title: Will a Formula 1 driver announce a candidacy for a political position in any country before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any current or former Formula 1 driver officially announces their candidacy for a political position in any country. The announcement must be made by the driver themselves or through an official campaign or political party channel. Political position refers to any elected or appointed office at any level of government, including but not limited to local, regional, national, or international bodies. Confirmation from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or the official social media accounts of the driver or their campaign will be considered valid evidence for resolution. In the event of a dispute over the authenticity of an announcement, the question will resolve based on the consensus of at least three reputable news sources.

title: Will FIFA implement a new policy to combat political interference in football governance before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, FIFA officially announces the implementation of a new policy aimed at combating political interference in football governance. The policy must be designed to address and mitigate the influence of political entities on the decision-making processes, operations, or management of football organizations under FIFA's purview. The announcement must come directly from an official FIFA communication channel or be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The policy must be actionable, with clear guidelines and mechanisms for enforcement, and not merely a statement of intent or a preliminary framework. In the event of ambiguous or partial implementation, the question will resolve as Yes only if the policy is officially adopted by FIFA and its member associations.

title: Will a major political party adopt policies influenced by string theory concepts before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major political party in any G7 country (United States, United Kingdom, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan) officially adopts one or more policies that are directly influenced by concepts from string theory. For the purposes of this question, a "major political party" is defined as one that holds or has held government office or is the official opposition. Policies influenced by string theory concepts must be explicitly acknowledged as such in the party's official policy documents, announcements, or through a statement by a party leader. The influence of string theory on the policy must be clear and direct, rather than speculative or tangential. In the absence of explicit acknowledgment, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the influence of string theory on the policy will be sufficient for resolution. This question resolves as YES upon such confirmation.

title: Will a significant discovery in genetics lead to a major shift in social sciences theories by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in genetics leads to a major shift in social sciences theories. A "significant discovery in genetics" refers to a breakthrough in understanding genetic influences on human behavior, cognition, or social structures that is widely recognized by the scientific community. A "major shift in social sciences theories" involves the adoption of new theoretical frameworks or substantial revision of existing theories in fields such as psychology, sociology, anthropology, or economics, as a direct result of the genetic discovery. The shift must be documented in peer-reviewed journals and recognized by at least two leading academic institutions or professional societies in the social sciences. In the absence of direct academic consensus, coverage by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian) confirming the impact of the genetic discovery on social sciences theories will be considered sufficient. The discovery and its implications must be clearly linked, with no significant controversy regarding the interpretation of the genetic findings.

title: Will Japan implement a groundbreaking social policy that becomes a model for other countries by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Japan has implemented a social policy that is recognized as groundbreaking and has been adopted or is in the process of being adopted as a model by at least one other country. The policy must address a significant social issue (e.g., aging population, education reform, healthcare, environmental sustainability) and demonstrate innovative approaches or solutions that distinguish it from existing policies. The adoption of the policy by another country must be confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be fully implemented within Japan and not merely proposed or in trial stages. In the event of multiple policies meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one policy fulfills all the specified conditions.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) initiate a policy that significantly alters the demographic landscape of the US by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Republican Party in the United States has initiated and implemented a policy or set of policies that have significantly altered the demographic landscape of the United States. Significant alteration is defined as a measurable change in the composition of the population by age, race, ethnicity, or immigration status, as reported by the United States Census Bureau or another authoritative government body. The policy must lead to a change that is statistically significant compared to trends observed prior to 2023. Changes solely due to natural demographic trends (e.g., aging population) without direct policy influence will not count towards this question's resolution. In the absence of direct government data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Policies that are proposed but not implemented, or those in trial phases without full implementation, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major breakthrough in medical technology influence the development of computing by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in medical technology has been officially recognized to significantly influence the development of computing. A "major breakthrough in medical technology" refers to a development that represents a significant advancement in medical science or practice, such as the invention of a new medical device, a novel therapeutic technique, or a groundbreaking diagnostic method. The influence on computing must be substantial, leading to notable advancements or changes in computing technology, methodologies, or applications. The breakthrough and its impact on computing must be confirmed by at least three reputable sources, which may include major scientific journals, official statements from technology or medical organizations, or reports from reputable news outlets (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, IEEE Spectrum).

title: Will an AI system win a Grand Slam tennis tournament by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, an artificial intelligence (AI) system is officially recognized as the winner of any of the four Grand Slam tennis tournaments (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, or US Open). The AI system must compete under the same conditions as human players and must win the tournament outright. The victory must be acknowledged by the official organizing body of the tournament and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The AI system is defined as a software system that can make decisions, adapt to playing conditions, and execute physical actions (via a robotic entity) with minimal human intervention. In the event of a team competition where both AI and human players are part of the team, the question will resolve as Yes only if the AI system is the primary contributor to the team's victory. Temporary exhibitions or special categories created specifically for AI or robotic participants do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will advancements in computing power significantly reduce the spread of climate change denial by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, advancements in computing power have led to a significant reduction in the spread of climate change denial, as evidenced by:

- A decrease of at least 30% in the prevalence of climate change denial content across major social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube) compared to 2023 levels, as reported by credible research organizations or peer-reviewed studies.
- A notable increase in the adoption of climate change mitigation technologies, directly attributed to enhanced computing capabilities, as reported by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or peer-reviewed scientific publications.

For the purpose of this question, "significant reduction" is defined as a measurable decrease in the spread of climate change denial content and an increase in public acceptance of climate science, directly attributable to advancements in computing power. The resolution will consider reports and studies that specifically analyze the impact of computing advancements on public perception and the spread of misinformation regarding climate change.

title: Will a significant discovery in the field of cryobiology emerge from research in NHL (non-Hodgkin lymphoma) by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in the field of cryobiology emerges from research specifically targeting non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL). A "significant discovery" is defined as a breakthrough that leads to a substantial improvement in cryopreservation techniques or outcomes directly applicable to NHL treatment or research. This includes, but is not limited to, advancements in the preservation of lymphatic tissue, significant increases in the viability of cryopreserved cells post-thaw, or novel cryoprotective agents with proven efficacy in NHL contexts.

The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major medical or cryobiology conference. It must also be recognized as a significant advancement by a consensus of experts in the field, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Science Magazine) or official press releases from leading medical research institutions.

In the event that multiple discoveries are reported, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. If no discovery meets these criteria by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Tesla's advancements in battery technology lead to a breakthrough in energy storage for scientific research by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Tesla has announced or demonstrated a breakthrough in battery technology that significantly enhances energy storage capabilities for scientific research purposes. A "breakthrough" is defined as a development that results in at least a 50% improvement in energy storage capacity, efficiency, or cost reduction compared to the best available technology as of 2023. The breakthrough must be applicable and scalable for use in scientific research, including but not limited to, energy storage for high-energy physics experiments, space exploration, or environmental monitoring. Confirmation of such a breakthrough must come from an official Tesla announcement or be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of direct confirmation, peer-reviewed scientific publications that cite Tesla's technology as the basis for the advancement qualify as evidence. The technology must be beyond the prototype stage and demonstrate practical applicability for scientific research.

title: Will China become the leading country in quantum computing research impacting the natural sciences by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, China is recognized as the leading country in quantum computing research with significant impacts on the natural sciences. Leading status can be determined by:
- The number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in quantum computing by Chinese researchers or institutions, compared to those from other countries.
- The establishment or operation of quantum computing facilities that are recognized as the most advanced in terms of computational capabilities or scientific breakthroughs.
- Recognition by international scientific organizations or panels as the leader in quantum computing research impacting the natural sciences.

Significant impact on the natural sciences must be evidenced by groundbreaking research findings or technological advancements in fields such as physics, chemistry, biology, and earth sciences, directly attributed to Chinese quantum computing research.

In the absence of clear international recognition, a consensus among reputable scientific publications (e.g., Nature, Science, IEEE Transactions on Quantum Engineering) and news outlets (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Science Daily) will be considered sufficient.

title: Will the United States become the world's largest producer of renewable energy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is officially recognized as the world's largest producer of renewable energy, measured by total megawatts (MW) of renewable energy capacity installed or by total renewable energy generated in a year. Renewable energy includes solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy sources. The assessment will be based on data and reports from authoritative sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), or equivalent. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the source with the most comprehensive and recent data will be considered authoritative. The resolution will consider only operational capacity, excluding projects under construction or in planning stages. In case of a tie or near-tie (within a 1% margin), the question will resolve as No, requiring clear leadership in renewable energy production.

title: Will FIFA's decision to expand the World Cup lead to a significant increase in global sports betting revenue by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant increase in global sports betting revenue attributed to FIFA's decision to expand the World Cup. A "significant increase" is defined as a rise of at least 20% in global sports betting revenue compared to the year prior to the expansion announcement, adjusted for inflation. The assessment of revenue figures must come from credible financial or sports analytics organizations. In the absence of direct attribution to the World Cup expansion, a consensus among at least three reputable financial or sports news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, ESPN, Financial Times) will be required for resolution. The question will resolve as No if these criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency integrate biotechnology for enhanced security or operations by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major cryptocurrency (defined as one within the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative source at the time of resolution) has officially integrated biotechnology for enhanced security or operations. Integration of biotechnology includes, but is not limited to, the use of biological systems, organisms, or derivatives thereof to improve cryptographic security, transaction verification processes, or any other operational aspect of the cryptocurrency. The integration must be confirmed by an official announcement from the cryptocurrency's development team or governing body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be operational and not merely proposed or in a trial phase. Temporary or experimental deployments do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a philosophical breakthrough influence the regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a philosophical breakthrough (defined as a significant advancement or discovery in ethical, moral, or philosophical reasoning that pertains to digital currencies or assets) directly influences the creation, amendment, or interpretation of regulatory frameworks for cryptocurrencies in any major economy (e.g., G7 countries).

The influence must be explicitly acknowledged by the regulatory body or government in official documentation, announcements, or through legislative history. In the absence of direct acknowledgment, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the philosophical breakthrough's impact on cryptocurrency regulation are sufficient.

The breakthrough must pertain specifically to cryptocurrencies and not general financial regulation. If the influence is part of broader financial regulatory changes, the specific impact on cryptocurrencies must be clearly delineated.

In the event of ambiguous cases, the resolution will consider expert analysis from recognized authorities in philosophy, economics, or law to determine the breakthrough's direct influence on cryptocurrency regulation.

title: Will Australia launch a national cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Australia has officially launched a national cryptocurrency. A "national cryptocurrency" is defined as a digital currency that is issued and regulated by the Australian government, recognized as legal tender within Australia, and intended for general public use. The launch must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. In the event of a limited launch (e.g., restricted to specific regions or for specific applications), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for nationwide use.

title: Will the average global temperature increase by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels before 2050?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2050, the global average temperature is confirmed to have increased by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels (defined as the average global temperature from 1850-1900). The assessment must be based on the annual average global surface temperature data as reported by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or another authoritative scientific body that is recognized by the scientific community. In the event that the IPCC or the designated authoritative body discontinues, merges, or is replaced, the most directly comparable successor organization will be used for the resolution. Should there be significant controversy or dispute within the scientific community regarding the accuracy or interpretation of the data, the question will resolve based on the consensus opinion of the scientific community as reflected in peer-reviewed scientific literature.

title: Will a new element be discovered by scientists in the field of natural sciences before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a new chemical element is officially recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC). The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed scientific research and meet the IUPAC criteria for the recognition of new elements, including but not limited to the observation of the element in a laboratory setting and the verification of its atomic number. The element must be distinct from all previously identified elements and must not have been artificially created solely through computational predictions. In the event that multiple new elements are discovered simultaneously, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them meets these criteria. Discoveries announced or recognized after the resolution date will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new species of deep-sea creature be discovered by marine biologists before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a new species of deep-sea creature is officially discovered and described by marine biologists. The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal dedicated to marine biology or zoology. The creature must be a previously unknown species, distinct from any currently cataloged species, and must inhabit ocean depths below 200 meters. The discovery must be recognized and validated by a reputable scientific body or institution specializing in marine biology. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such documented discovery. Discoveries announced but not peer-reviewed by the resolution date will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a health and wellness rewards program regulated by the Food and Drug Administration by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a health and wellness rewards program that is regulated by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

For the purpose of this question, a "major cryptocurrency platform" is defined as a platform with at least 1 million active users worldwide. The health and wellness rewards program must offer incentives, such as discounts or cryptocurrency rewards, for activities or behaviors that promote health and wellness, as recognized by the FDA.

The introduction of such a program must be confirmed by an official announcement from the cryptocurrency platform and documentation of FDA regulation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution. The program must be fully operational and available to the platform's users by the resolution date.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics start tracking employment trends within the cryptocurrency sector by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) has officially begun tracking and reporting employment trends within the cryptocurrency sector. The tracking must include specific data on employment rates, job creation, and other relevant labor market trends within the sector. Confirmation must come from an official BLS announcement or publication on their website. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, Bloomberg) will be considered sufficient evidence. The inclusion of the cryptocurrency sector in the BLS's regular reporting, such as the monthly Employment Situation report, or a dedicated new report series, will be required for this question to resolve as Yes.

title: Will FIFA partner with a leading cryptocurrency to offer exclusive digital collectibles for the World Cup by 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, FIFA has officially partnered with one or more leading cryptocurrencies to offer exclusive digital collectibles related to the World Cup. A "leading cryptocurrency" is defined as one that is ranked within the top 20 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative cryptocurrency market analysis website at the time of the partnership announcement. The partnership must be confirmed through an official announcement by FIFA or the cryptocurrency entity. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The digital collectibles must be specifically related to the World Cup and available for purchase or acquisition by the public. This question will resolve as No if no such partnership is announced by the specified date.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration's new policies significantly influence the outcome of the next US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1 following the next US presidential election, there is clear evidence that the Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) new policies have significantly influenced the outcome of the presidential election. Significant influence is defined as a measurable impact on voter behavior, election results, or public opinion, directly attributable to the FDA's policies. This impact must be confirmed by at least three reputable sources (e.g., major news organizations like BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post, or academic studies). In the absence of direct evidence, a consensus among political analysts from at least three major news organizations or academic institutions that the FDA's policies played a critical role in the election outcome will also result in a Yes resolution. The resolution will consider only policies introduced before the election year.

title: Will a major baseball event or scandal significantly influence the outcome of any major elections in the US before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major baseball event or scandal is widely reported to have significantly influenced the outcome of any major U.S. elections. A "major baseball event or scandal" refers to any event related to professional baseball that receives widespread national media coverage and is directly linked by reputable sources to influencing voter behavior or election outcomes. This includes, but is not limited to, events involving major league baseball teams, players, or associated personnel. The influence on the election must be confirmed by analysis or polling data reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of direct polling data, a consensus among political analysts reported in these outlets may also suffice. The elections considered will include presidential, congressional, and gubernatorial races. This question will resolve as No if no such event or scandal is reported to meet these criteria by the specified date.

title: Will France see a major electoral reform as a result of a significant social movement before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, France undergoes a major electoral reform directly attributed to a significant social movement. A "major electoral reform" is defined as a change in the electoral system that affects the method of voting, the way votes are counted, or the structure of representation in at least one chamber of the national parliament. A "significant social movement" must be a widespread, organized campaign or protest recognized by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Le Monde, New York Times, Washington Post) as having a substantial impact on public opinion or policy. The reform must be officially adopted by the French government and reported by at least one of these news organizations. In the event of ambiguous situations, such as reforms proposed but not implemented, or minor changes presented as major, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered on their individual merits, with a preference for consensus among reputable sources.

title: Will India implement a nationwide policy to significantly reduce air pollution levels by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, India has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at significantly reducing air pollution levels. The policy must demonstrate a clear, measurable goal for reduction in major pollutants (e.g., PM2.5, PM10, NOx, SO2) compared to 2020 levels. Significant reduction is defined as a decrease of at least 20% in the annual average concentration of these pollutants across major cities in India. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be in effect, not merely proposed or in a planning stage. In the event of regional policies that collectively cover the entire nation, the question will resolve as Yes if these policies meet the overall reduction goal.

title: Will a player from the NHL win the Nobel Peace Prize for their humanitarian efforts by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a current or former National Hockey League (NHL) player is officially awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for their humanitarian efforts. The player must be recognized as an individual laureate or as a part of an organization that is awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, where the player's contributions to the organization's humanitarian efforts are explicitly acknowledged. The award must be confirmed by the official Nobel Prize announcement. In the event that multiple NHL players are awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for their humanitarian efforts within the timeframe, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the players meets the above criteria. Temporary or honorary recognitions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Germany achieve a 30% reduction in homelessness by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Germany has achieved a 30% reduction in the number of homeless individuals compared to the baseline figure reported for the year 2020. The baseline and subsequent figures must be reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany (Statistisches Bundesamt) or another official government body. In the absence of official statistics, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered. The reduction must be sustained and not a temporary fluctuation. In the event of a change in the methodology for counting homeless individuals, the resolution criteria will adjust to ensure comparability.

title: Will the NBA adopt AI-driven strategies for game analysis and player performance optimization by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Basketball Association (NBA) has officially adopted artificial intelligence-driven strategies for game analysis and player performance optimization across any of its teams. The adoption must be confirmed through official NBA announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. The strategies must be implemented in actual game planning, player training, or performance analysis, not merely in experimental or trial phases. AI-driven strategies refer to systems that utilize machine learning, data analytics, or other forms of artificial intelligence to analyze game footage, player statistics, or other relevant data to enhance team performance or player conditioning. In the event of partial adoption (e.g., limited to specific teams), the question will resolve as Yes if there is an intention for league-wide implementation. Temporary uses or the application of AI in unrelated areas (e.g., fan engagement, marketing) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new algorithm significantly improve cybersecurity measures for political parties in the US by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new algorithm is developed and has been publicly recognized to significantly improve cybersecurity measures for political parties in the United States. Significant improvement is defined as a reduction in successful cyber attacks against political parties by at least 50% compared to the year prior to the algorithm's implementation, as reported by a reputable cybersecurity firm or a governmental cybersecurity agency. The algorithm must be implemented and operational within at least one major political party in the US (Democratic Party, Republican Party, or any other party with national representation). Confirmation of the algorithm's effectiveness must come from credible sources, such as official statements from political parties, cybersecurity firms, or coverage in at least three reputable news outlets (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event that multiple algorithms claim to meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them is verifiably in use and meets the defined improvement threshold.

title: Will FIFA implement an AI system for real-time game analytics and decision-making by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially implemented an artificial intelligence system for real-time game analytics and decision-making in official matches. The system must be capable of analyzing gameplay, making decisions on game events (e.g., offsides, fouls), and providing analytics that are used in real-time during matches. Implementation must be confirmed by an official FIFA announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, BBC Sport, Sky Sports, or similar) are sufficient. The system must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific tournaments), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for use in all FIFA-sanctioned matches. Temporary deployments for specific events or the use of similar technology in non-official matches do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new vaccine for a major infectious disease be approved by the FDA by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved a new vaccine for a major infectious disease. A "major infectious disease" is defined as a disease that has caused significant morbidity or mortality in the United States or globally within the last 10 years, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The approval must be for a vaccine that has not been previously available in the United States, and it must be intended for widespread use rather than limited to emergency authorization. The resolution will be based on official FDA announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The vaccine must be available for distribution within the United States to count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant increase in global health funding due to climate-related diseases by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant increase in global health funding specifically allocated to address climate-related diseases. A "significant increase" is defined as a rise of at least 25% in total funding compared to the year 2020, adjusted for inflation. Climate-related diseases include, but are not limited to, vector-borne diseases, heat-related illnesses, and water-borne diseases. The increase in funding must be confirmed by official reports or statements from major global health organizations such as the World Health Organization (WHO), the United Nations (UN), or the World Bank. In the absence of direct statements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The funding increase must be specifically earmarked for research, prevention, and treatment of climate-related diseases. General increases in health funding without explicit allocation to climate-related diseases do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the outcome of the 2020 US presidential election have a lasting impact on public health policy in the United States by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there are significant and lasting changes in public health policy in the United States that can be directly attributed to the outcome of the 2020 US presidential election. Significant changes include, but are not limited to, reforms in healthcare access, pandemic preparedness, mental health services, and environmental health policies. The changes must be enacted into law or official policy and must have been implemented with evidence of impact. Attribution to the 2020 election outcome must be confirmed through official statements, legislative records, or analysis by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among at least three health policy experts featured in major publications may also suffice. Temporary measures or policies that are reversed before the resolution date do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a groundbreaking discovery related to dark matter be confirmed by the scientific community before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a groundbreaking discovery related to dark matter is confirmed by the scientific community. A "groundbreaking discovery" is defined as a discovery that significantly alters the current understanding of dark matter, its properties, or its role in the universe. This includes, but is not limited to, direct detection of dark matter particles, a conclusive demonstration of dark matter's interaction with ordinary matter beyond gravitational effects, or the discovery of phenomena that cannot be explained without invoking dark matter. The confirmation must come from findings published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by a consensus of the scientific community, including major organizations such as the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN), the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), or the European Space Agency (ESA). In the absence of a consensus, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for the most widely accepted scientific standards at the time of discovery.

title: Will a study published before 2030 demonstrate a significant impact of climate change on soccer playing conditions worldwide?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, a peer-reviewed study is published demonstrating a significant impact of climate change on soccer playing conditions worldwide. Significant impact is defined as changes that affect the health and performance of players, the scheduling and locations of matches, or the physical conditions of playing fields. The study must be recognized by a leading scientific organization or journal in the field of climate science, sports science, or a related field. In the absence of a single comprehensive study, a consensus among multiple studies published in reputable scientific journals may also satisfy this criterion. The resolution will rely on reports from authoritative sources such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), World Health Organization (WHO), or major sports governing bodies like FIFA. In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these sources will determine the outcome. Edge cases, such as localized impacts not reflective of global trends, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new infectious disease emerge by 2030 that leads to a global pandemic with a mortality rate exceeding that of COVID-19?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new infectious disease emerges that leads to a global pandemic with a mortality rate exceeding that of COVID-19 as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO). The mortality rate is defined as the number of confirmed deaths divided by the number of confirmed cases. For the purpose of this question, "global pandemic" is defined as an outbreak of a disease that occurs over a wide geographic area and affects an exceptionally high proportion of the global population. The emergence of the disease must be confirmed by the WHO, and its global impact must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event that the WHO is dissolved or rendered inactive, a consensus of at least three leading health organizations (e.g., CDC, ECDC, China CDC) will be required for resolution. The question will resolve as No if no such disease emerges by the specified date.
